results.description:
Bring your laptop, current project(s), and prepare to make some progress! Folks have walked away grinning from our previous project nights after solving problems that had been frustrating them for a while. We'll do introductions around 6:30pm to get a sense of the skill set in the room, then settle in to work.

These sessions are super-informal and low-key. We always have attendees of all experience levels--don't feel like you have to be "good" or know "something" before you can come hang out with us. If you feel like the term pre-beginner applies to you, project nights are a great time to meet other code-curious women and start figuring out what you need to learn to start working toward your goals. We guarantee that you'll meet someone who will nerd out about what you are interested in and make you excited to start tinkering.

On hand to help out will be:

Mel Choyce is a design engineer at Automattic, where she works mostly on design and front-end development. Feel free to ask her about UI design, UX and user testing, HTML/CSS, and any beginner WordPress questions.

Kelly Dwan is a WordPress developer and core contributor. Familiar with the ins and outs of WordPress, she's happy to answer any theme or plugin development questions, or anything PHP, JS, CSS, HTML.

Paige Eaton is a librarian turned Drupal developer. She loves sports, games, and long walks on the beach, but not too long. It's really tiring to walk on sand. Paige is helpful for questions about UX, HTML, CSS, some PHP, and is a good listener/sounding board for ideas & projects.

Kelly Buchanan is a full stack web dev at an ed tech company. Her background includes web dev, educational research, and computational data analysis. Ask her questions about Python, Ruby, Java, and JavaScript.

Reasons why you should come work with us:

Accountability: it's the perfect way to get away from it all (other work, family, the laundry) and work.

Nerd friends: you'll meet other women who are coding and creating awesome stuff.

Practice: it's an opportunity to practice some of the skills you've picked up if you've taken some of our classes.

Brain exchange: you can ask your neighbor for help on a bug or teach a n00b how to do something you've mastered.

No agenda: Have non-technical work to do? Need a sounding board? Looking for feedback? Just want to get your inbox under control? You're welcome too!

Perks:

+ Fast, reliable internet

+ Fancy, schmancy (i.e., comfy) Aeron chairs

+ Way more fun than working in a coffee shop =)

Location

14th floor, Room Charles

Cambridge Innovation Center

1 Broadway

Cambridge, MA 02142

T Stop: Kendall / MIT

Street parking is available on Broadway St., Third St., and Main St.

Access

Please bring photo ID. Upon entering 1 Broadway you'll check in with security. Tell them you're visiting the 14th floor.

Doors open at 6:15pm; if you arrive before 6:15pm, please wait in the 1st floor lobby, as no one will be available to let you in upstairs.

Once you depart the elevator, you'll find glass doors that are locked. Look for the tablet door sign and find your name in the list to ring the doorbell.

We're meeting in the room labeled Charles.

results.description:
Whatever your gender, if you identify as nonmonogamous and queer, you're welcome at our social! This was a one-off event, and it went so well we chose to host it again.

There is no cost to participate, but we do ask that each guest who is able to do so purchase a food or drink item from the restaurant where we are meeting, so we will continue to be welcomed in the future.

We are normally in the back room of the cafe.

*A note on inclusivity. All who self-identify as queer and nonmonogamous are welcome to participate. We will not quiz you on how you identify. You may also bring a friend or partner who does not identify as queer if you wish to do so. As we are most interested in creating a space for queer people to meet and speak with each other, we ask that those who do not self-identify as queer not attend the meetup solo. This is our initial guideline only - if this becomes a regular event all attendees can discuss how we want to handle this issue.

This new event is hosted by members of the Boston Queer Poly Women's Meetup & Boston Metro Area Poly

WE ARE BACK AT TRIANGLE PARK FOR TONIGHT, PLEASE TAKE NOTE OF THIS.

6:30-6:45 pm - Warm up & practice, we'll work on some throws, passes & catches.

6:45 pm - Game starts.

General guidelines: Dress accordingly. Bring a white & dark shirt so we can easily divide into 2 teams. Have plenty of water. Sunscreen on a sunny day. Stretch & warm up. We'll provide discs and cones.

Weather: Rain in New England is unpredictable. We will send out a final notice one hour before start time if cancellation is necessary.

RSVP: Very helpful as this is how we contact you in case of game changes & cancellations.

About: Playing Ultimate is all about good sportsmanship, respect, and gracefulness on the field.  Fun & having a good time is a must above anything else. It's an easy game to pick up & we keep the rules minimal. No zones, no stall count, no scores, and players self-officiate on the field.  Open to all levels of players.  Beginners welcome.

Warning: Excessive fun & comradery developed from playing Ultimate may become addicting.

results.description:
Come join David and friends for a night of Magic: The Gathering over at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford. This event is part of our "Wednesday Night Magic" series.

It doesn't matter if you are an expert "planeswalker", or don't know anything about Magic: The Gathering -- you can come to play or learn this amazing strategy game.  There are usually between 6-12 people at each event, consisting of all experience levels.  All decks of all types are welcome for this "casual play" event.  Beginners who want to learn are welcome!

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that MTG Boston members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.

results.description:
For the last few months we have been talking, playing, and evening experimenting with the Law of Attraction. Many have experienced the evidence that the Law of Attraction holds a lot of power. Some have played with finding parking spaces and others have manifested cash in a matter of minutes.


Why is it that some can create big desires instantly and others only get small wishes? What are some of the keys that help to speed up the process. One factor is that your intention and core beliefs play a vital role in determining your outcome. If you want to achieve success now, you can!

For instance, when you concentrate on the positive, your life will be positive. It sounds simple enough, but many times people let negative emotions get the better of them. So what do you do to release the thoughts that move you away from your desires and attract pleasant thoughts that move you towards manifestation? It starts with becoming aware of these negative thoughts and then quieting the mind. Simple step, yes!  Want to become more aware?

Then Join Us as we:

• Become Aware of Thoughts

• Practice Quieting the Mind

• Open up the Heart

• Create Our Intention


•  Take Action to Speed up the Process

See you soon.

Ellen Sklaver, NLP & PSYCH-K Facilitator


[masked]

results.description:
This month we will be looking at the current beta release of Leaflet.js v1.0 to answer questions like:

• What's new in 1.0? (hint: a lot)

• What is the roadmap for upgrading?

• How cool are those new animations?!?!?!

There will be a live coding example during the meeting. Ryan will make a repo available on GitHub prior to the meeting, but feel free to bring your own projects in and start playing around. 

--------

As always, beginners very welcome. Please bring a laptop.  Pizza will be provided once again, courtesy of CartoDB.


When you enter the building, check in with security - let them know you're attending Maptime on the 4th floor.


--------


Maptime is, rather literally, time for mapmaking. Our mission is to open the doors of cartographic possibility to anyone interested by creating a time and space for collaborative learning, exploration, and map creation using mapping tools and technologies.


This open learning environment for all levels and degrees of knowledge offers intentional support for the beginner. Maptime is simultaneously flexible and structured, creating space for workshops, ongoing projects with a shared goal, and independent/collaborative work time.


Inspiration for Maptime comes from both hack nights and knitting circles. Both are models of spaces for people to create and learn together. Our goal is to provide this space with an open heart and without pretension. You can bring your own projects to work on, or just hang out and socialize or ask questions. Some people are experts, and some people are just getting started, but all of us are learning, so why not do it together?


Maptime is hands-on, so don't forget to bring your laptop!

results.name: Leaflet 1.0

results.description:
Dreamland, Kevin Baker

A literary tour de force, a magnificent chronicle of a remarkable era and a place of dreams

In a stunning work of imagination and memory, author Kevin Baker brings to mesmerizing life a vibrant, colorful, thrilling, and dangerous New York City in the earliest years of the twentieth century. A novel breathtaking in its scope and ambition, it is the epic saga of newcomers drawn to the promise of America—gangsters and laborers, hucksters and politicians, radicals, reformers, murderers, and sideshow oddities—whose stories of love, revenge, and tragedy interweave and shine in the artificial electric dazzle of a wondrous place called Dreamland.

results.description:
Most Wednesdays we gather for an open gaming night at the Panera in Porter Square. This event is open to anyone, and usually doesn't have any sort of pre-arranged agenda -- anything you can bring is fair game, provided you can get it done in three hours!

* Your gallant host almost always brings something to play, and takes requests if you get said request to him by Tuesday night at the latest. Behold the collection: http://www.bgg.cc/collection/user/CmdrOverbite?gallery=large&rankobjecttype=subtype&rankobjectid=1&columns=title%7Cstatus%7Cversion%7Crating%7Cbggrating%7Cplays%7Ccomment%7Ccommands&geekranks=%0A%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09Board+Game+Rank%0A%09%09%09%09%09%09%09%09&own=1&objecttype=thing&ff=1&subtype=boardgame

* Due to logistical concerns and a desire to keep peace with the management (who have been notably chill thus far about a bunch of freeloading nerds taking up their table space), I have set a limit of twelve attendees on these events going forward. I doubt this will be much of an issue, given our typical attendance numbers.

* Because our events tend to be small, and the games we typically play tend to be long, if at all possible, please let us know if you plan to be more than a couple of minutes late so that we don't launch into something without you. Likewise, if you're planning on arriving more than a half-hour late, you should be aware that it may not be possible to include you in a game. You're welcome to come by and hang out but the chances are better than even that we'll be hip-deep in gaming goodness by the time you arrive.

* Please be respectful of our hosts; stay mindful of closing time and throw 'em some business if you're hungry.

* Have fun and roll high!

results.description: "I appeal to you, brothers, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree, and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be united in the same mind and the same judgment."  Perhaps one of the most troubled churches we see in the New Testament while also being one of the most blessed, Corinth is an example of God's grace not to give up on a struggling church, as well as an example of how to be the church God wants.  1 (and 2!) Corinthians, Paul's back-to-back letters to the saints in Corinth, provide great insight into unity, maturity, church growth, humility, love, the resurrection, church discipline, salvation, faith, and a number of essential topics for those seeking God.  Come join us in our study of 1 Corinthians!

results.description:
"Who you are is nothing but a pack or neurons." (Francis Crick)

"Are we now what will be? Are we fixed or free?" (Son Lux)

It's a classic question, whether theological or biological...to what extent are we really free to make choices? Is everything pre-determined? Can both somehow be true? 

An interesting article (though a bit on the longer side) about NYU philosopher Thomas Nagel's rejection of philosophical materialism and the rejection that's come as a result: http://www.weeklystandard.com/articles/heretic_707692.html

And somewhat the counter argument: http://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2014/03/the-war-on-reason/357561/

This is not the regular monthly Boston West Meetup. This is a new ukulele players meetup. 

After finishing a recent beginners class, there was interest in continuing to meet and play songs, but in a learning kind of way. Practice transitions, play the song slowly , and then a little faster. For about two months we are going to meeting every other Wednesday  for an hour or so, starting on the 19th. I'm asking people to bring the Daily Ukulele - available on Amazon and locally. If you don't have one yet I'm sure someone will let you look at theirs but I recommend getting it.

The donation for the location will be $5/person plus you have to purchase The Daily Ukulele from Amazon, ebay, music store, etc..  Let me know if you have any questions..

Pat Sorn

results.description:
Welcome to the weekly BKBS Wednesday meet up. Please join us at 7:00 PM by the 3rd table station in the middle of the top roping / lead area. If you are still by the bouldering wall, keep on walking.

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.how_to_find_us: The third table in the middle of the climbing area between 7:00-7:10 PM. It's the table in the middle of the TR \/ Lead area.
results.name: Brooklyn Boulders Somerville Wednesday

This is a free meditation session, and an introduction to the Art of Living course, meant to bring people together for a few moments of perfect tranquility in the heart of Cambridge. Join us as we practice meditation and mindfulness, and hang around later to interact with like-minded people over a relaxing cup of tea. These sessions are being offered by the Art of Living Foundation, a non-profit organization engaged in service initiatives across 153 countries. So, come, empty your minds, and fill up your teacups!

No meditation experience required, all are welcome. Please RSVP!

Please note that like last time, we are meeting just down the street from the usual building. Security at the main Akamai building should know to redirect folks, but just in case.

As usual, we will be meeting from 7-9pm. 

Edward Kmett will give a talk on his work on current work on porting Clojure-style transients to Haskell.

It'd also be good to have a session where we try to get a sense of what folks would like to hear more about over the coming year.

Logistics: 


If you can, please plan on arriving between 6:45pm and 7pm, but there will be someone in the lobby to greet stragglers.

Food:

Pizzas, salad and soda.

Afterwards:

If you'd like to stick around, a number of us tend to head down to the CBC or another pub afterwards to socialize. If you would like to give a talk or if you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to follow up here or email one of the organizers.

results.description:
JP Comics & Games in Jamaica Plain is now running a table for players interested in the newly-begun season of D&D 5e weekly Encounters every Wednesday from 7-9.

"Unearth the Deception" and help stop the forces of Elemental Evil from plunging the Sword Coast into chaos. Designed to take players from level 1 to level 5 by the time the season ends in August, this is a great way to (re)introduce yourself to D&D's current edition and get immersed in a storyline that harks back to the origins of the game.

Pre-generated characters are available, as is help to build your own, so feel free to drop in or contact Ted Atkinson if you'd like more information.

results.description:
Hey all! Boston needs to step up and show their community pride! 

Let's get together, here's why...

We have so many great community pros and companies in Boston and Cambridge. We'll all be more successful if we build stronger bonds between us, share challenges and offer support for one another, and grow our presence outside of Boston. 

What do NYC and SF have on our community know-how? Nada.

So, let's get together for casual drinks at a local watering hole and brainstorm some community/world domination ideas. Or, you know, just catch up on each other's lives and work.

Please RSVP, if you're coming. It'll help us spot each other the day of the meetup.

I'd love help with these items to get this event ready:

• Great locations for meetups


• Who we should be asking to join the fun


• The best ways to reach out to other community pros

I'd love help with these things for future events:

• Potential sponsors


• Future event or meetup ideas


• Any community resources you'd like to see 

Please reach out! The more the merrier.
results.name: Community Drinks

results.description:
The theme for our Aug. 19 session will be on Creating Inner Peace, Health and Well-Being. 

Meditation can be one of the easiest and most effective means to living with greater harmony, happiness and well-being. It’s also an opportunity to peacefully transform your problems, your fears, and any pain and stress in your life into something more positive.

In our last session, almost everyone arrived feeling stressed and drained from their day.  By the end of the evening, though, everyone felt a complete positive shift, with new insights for moving forward differently to experience more inner peace and calm throughout their day.


We also consider meditating one of the most direct and easiest ways to connect to your greater Spirit-Self ; and to be in a vibration that allows all that you desire to easily flow to you. We think it's one of the most valuable practices you can have to effectively use the law of attraction, and to feel good (also important for manifesting good things)!

Please join us for another evening of pure relaxed bliss; insight, inspiration, and upliftment!  I make it really easy for you, too. So mark your calendars to save the date, RSVP YES, and we'll see you there!

This will be the last meditation session this summer. In September, we will return to our meditation sessions on the 1st and 3rd Friday evenings each month, beginning on Sept. 18th.  And our other meetup events will begin again, as well.

To encourage and support your practice, if you pay for 4 classes, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check).   Or, you can pay for one class at a time for $20. You do not have to commit to attending every class, however, the more you attend, the more you will benefit!  Just RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner.

Here's the general description of these meditation sessions:

Are you aware of the many benefits of meditating, but can’t get yourself to do it, or it’s too difficult to do on your own?

Do you enjoy the collective energy and ease of guided group meditations?

By participating in these guided meditations classes, you’ll experience how simple,delightful and easy it can be. You’ll learn and practice:

• Simple yet profound techniques you can easily do for yourself for any length of time that is comfortable for you.

• How to easily get into a meditative state to deeply relax and to create positive, pleasurable feelings, including inner peace, love, ease and joy; and how to bring that into your daily living.

Techniques to help you shift your perspective and experience of issues in your life causing you stress in some form, and to shift to Spirit perspective, instead.

• How to connect to your inner resources and your best self, to solution consciousness, and how to activate your body's natural healing response.

We have a different theme each class to help build and reinforce positive thinking patterns, beliefs and inner narratives that will support you in living with greater inner peace, love, ease and joy.

Each class consists of 2-3 guided meditations, with discussion and instruction in between to help you carry the positive feelings and lessons experienced into your day and life.

This is a perfect time to let go of stress and "busy-ness", and to fully let go and relax into bliss.  Come with whatever intentions suit you, and the evening is still sure to satisfy.  It always works out magically that way.

You're encouraged to bring a journal or notebook and pen to class.

“I'm leaving refreshed, optimistic, empowered, full of love, and excited about bringing more spirit into everything I do.  I’m sure that practicing the techniques I learned tonight will help me very much.  Thank you!!! "

"Great meditations!  I had a marvelous experience with each of them and a lot to take with me: powerful imagery, good feelings, and new techniques for connecting myself with the Universe. Loved the “love ripple”!”

Class leader (and meetup organizer): Ann Ide, M.A., certified master practitioner in Neuro-linguistic Programming and Hypnotherapy, and certified NLP Life Coach. Ann coaches people to move beyond their personal struggles, to new levels of harmony, happiness and success. With her expert questioning, inner exploration processes and personal change interventions, clients become able to more easily create the happiness they desire.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the basement level Roots Studio; (Note: extra parking available on Stratford St., by the Dairy Queen. Do not park at the DQ).
results.name: Guided Meditation Class for Experiencing Greater Inner Peace, Love, Ease and JOY

http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=186541038

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. The location for this volleyball meetup is at the JCC of the North Shore, 4 Community Road, Marblehead, MA[masked] | Home Page:

Monthly Schedule: Some people can only make weeknights. Some only weekends, so we'll be alternating dates every month. Thanks for your cooperation.


Casual Agenda: Let's hang out and get to know each other. The idea behind this meetup is for Content Creators to find other talented and skilled people to collaborate with and learn from. We'll move away from the "lecture" style that the meetups keep turning into for some reason, and more to just having fun and linking up with people to potentially work together with!

Bring a laptop, tablet, or anything else if you'd like to show some of your work, but note that we may have to screen them silently (or quietly) so as not to disturb other patrons.

Be ready to pitch ideas for projects. Michelle will take notes and post it on the Messageboard afterward so people can get involved if they are interested.

See you then!

Parking: Free! Thanks to Sammie for the venue suggestion!

This month's success story: After meeting Brendon (Green Beatbox) at the first meetup, Michelle ended up shooting a couple of virtual reality music videos with him and World Champion Accordionist, Cory Pesaturo. Those will be up at youtube.com/kill9tv next week. This is an example of the kind of collaborations/friendships you can hopefully form by attening these meetups! :)

Got a success story? Message Michelle with a collaboration or other win you scored through attending these meetups! <3

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

8:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

8:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

8:20 - Play!!!!!!

10:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing


Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a dark or white "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!

results.description:
Let's enjoy a lunch out during the Dine Out Boston promotion!  Scampo, is a great restaurant at the Liberty Hotel on Charles Street in Boston.  You can view the lunch menu for this event on the website.  http://scampoboston.com   

The Liberty Hotel is a fun destination in itself!  From their website:  "Always an architectural gem, what was once the iconic Charles Street Jail is now the stunning, vibrant Liberty Hotel. Since opening in September 2007, the Boston luxury hotel quickly became the "must-visit" downtown Boston destination for visitors and local residents alike."   Come early or stay later for a walk in the lovely shops on Charles Street.  Easy access by the T...Scampo is right next to the Charles/MGH station.  

I am asking for payment in order to rsvp.  $35 payment includes $25 3 course lunch at Scampo plus tax and gratuity.  Plus enough to cover the credit card charge charged to me by Wepay.com site.   I find that payment ahead of time is a good way to insure that only those who are sure that they can come will sign up, and we don't have lots of last minute cancellations.  

Please note that if this event fills and you are interested in being on a waiting list to comment on this event page.  We will reach out to you if someone has paid and is unable to attend.
results.how_to_find_us: Let's gather in the front entrance at 12:15 for our 12:30 lunch reservation.  I will send an e-mail with more details the day before.
results.name: Dine Out Boston Week Lunch Scampo restaurant at Liberty Hotel Boston

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

Hello Ladies!

Connect is the theme for the third Thursday event at the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum this week.  Why not get together and do some networking?  Or, we could all just hang out and enjoy the museum and activities!

In August, the Gardner partners up withFuture Boston Alliance and Startup Institute for an evening of connections—through hands-on art making, illuminating conversations, and more.

Cash wine bar around the Courtyard. Café G open for snacks, dinner, and drinks.

Tickets $5-$15 | Purchase online or at[masked]

TICKETS
Tickets are required and include Museum admission: adults $15, seniors $12,members free, students $5.

Students from colleges and universities participating in the University Membership Program receive free admission. See a list of participating schools.

HOW TO BUY TICKETS
• Online: Click the GET TICKETS button above*
• By phone:[masked]*
• In person: Visit the Museum and purchase at the door

BOX OFFICE HOURS
Wednesday–Monday, 10 am–4 pm; Thursday until 6 pm; closed Tuesday

*Handling charges apply to these orders.

By the way!  The Third Thursday events at the Gardner can get very crowded.  I'll try to find all of you, but if anyone gets lost, just message me and we can find each other in the garden.

Best,

Asther

Join us every Thursday night this summer (weather permitting) for the famous Hebert Candy Mansion car shows! Let's go and see some sweet rides, show off your own wheels, and have some sweet treats!

To satisfy your sweet tooth, The Candy Mansion stays open late on Cruzzin' nites. till 8pm. Check out their Facebook page for weather cancellations and special prizes!

If you want to meet us there, the address for the Candy Mansion is 575 Hartford Tpke, Shrewsbury, MA

The safest way to exit (and sometimes enter) the Candy Mansion is from Centech Blvd... it is the road beside the mansion with a traffic light, then use the side entrance at Cherry St.  Especially when you are leaving the property, I recommended that you go behind the mansion to get to the side road then take a left onto Cherry St. and a left again onto Centech Blvd. to the traffic light at Rt. 20.

This is a special event tonight only with the Cape Breton Fiddlers Association arriving from Nova Scotia. There will be a meet and greet at 6:00pm and session will start at 7:00pm. It will be "upstairs" in the  air conditioned hall because we expect a large turnout.  $5.00 donation at the door.

This is a Ongoing Irish Session hosted by Joey Abarta and friends. Any musician is welcome to sit in and play. Mostly Irish tunes. There is a 5.00 cover charge to help pay for the session. Cash bar. Everyone welcome. No reservation needed just drop in at 7:00pm. Very informal.......come and play or just come and listen......the music is always amazing. Joey Abarta is a well know  Irish musician, you can check him out on utube, he is truly amazing. He welcomes any musician to join him.

What a great way to unwind from a hectic week at work, sit back, listen, have a snack and a cocktail or cup of Barry's Tea. Very welcoming crowd.

Host is Linda the bartender. Introduce yourself to her. Expect a great night of music and friendship from all at the club. It is downstairs in the Pub, a warm old fashioned retro style Pub. Give your name to Linda for a chance on a draw to be pulled in September.

We're excited to bring you August's Board Game Night, as always hosted by East Coast Product, and this month sponsored byWeWork Fort Point and Down East Cider. 

Your $5 registration includes drinks and snacks. All proceeds benefit the ever awesome Resilient Coders, an organization dedicated to making web tech education more accessible to urban youth. Half-networking, half-gaming -- it's the only event in Boston that brings together innovation enthusiasts for an evening of friendly competition and great conversation. At this August's Board Game Night, we are raffling off a new board game, anyone can win!

Trivia questions will feature a lot of Red Sox Player Nick Names & Hall of Fame Questions. This is Individual or Group Trivia with Teams of 2 people. You do not need to play in order to attend. For any of you first timers, we actually kind of give you the answers to the questions before we start!

"50 SEASONS of RED SOX TRIVIA" is an EXCLUSIVE EVENT produced by the Red Sox Natives.

Do you know your Red Sox Baseball from the past 50 years? Do you want to compete to win a $50.00 Gift Card to Laurie's 909 or maybe a pair of Red Sox Tickets?

Please join the Red Sox Natives for "50 Seasons of Red Sox Trivia" - The Nick Name/Hall of Fame Edition at Laurie's 909 on Thursday, August 20. We are looking for a few good Red Sox fans to challenge prior winners from the Natives, Wakefield Weeknights and Laurie's 909 regulars. Individual or Group Trivia with teams of 2 people until the trading deadline as the night will play out like a Baseball season. You have to join us to get it!

This Event is sponsored by Red Sox Natives Sponsor Laurie's 909 and Red Sox Native Bob from Laurie's along with Dan Pranka from New England Sports Tours. 

Here is the Lineup for the evening:

1. Arrive after work or 6:00pm

2. Enjoy cocktails, appetizers, and dinner with other Red Sox Natives and fans. 

3. Talk Baseball with the Red Sox Natives and other Red Sox fans.

4. Register between 6:00pm and 7:00pm to play 50 Seasons of Red Sox Trivia

5. Red Sox Trivia Begins between 7:00pm and 7:15pm.

6. Individual or Group Teams of 2 people answer approximately 75 questions from Seasons 1965 thru 2015. There will be questions from these seasons and the decades.

7. Individual or Groups with most correct answers and points wins a $50.00 Laurie's 909 Gift Card or maybe a pair of Red Sox tickets. The 2nd and 3rd place individuals win a Gift Card for a free appetizer from Laurie's 909.

 8. Approximately 1.5 to 2 Hour duration.

 9. Take the 909  train back to Boston if you are attending from the City. 

We will be gathering at the "Nickel" Bar at Laurie's.

There is no cover or trivia entry fee.

Full menu is available until 9:30pm. Late night menu is available afterward. If you have a group of people that want a table reservation for dinner please call Laurie's at[masked] and make a reservation. For information on Laurie's 909 and the menu go to www.lauries909.com. .

If this will be your first time meeting the Red Sox Natives Crew please check out the photos of those who RSVP Yes so you can find the group.

Please remember to maintain your own tab or pay as you order and tip your servers. However, if you sit at a group table a group bill may be provided so please communicate with your server when ordering. Credit Cards may be held by the servers at Laurie's.

Laurie's 909 is Wakefield's newest restaurant and Bar with live entertainment several nights per week and many special E Mail list promotions. Laurie's is located at the Wakefield Commuter Rail Train Station in Wakefield. The Reading and Haverhill Commuter Rail trains stop at Laurie's. Laurie's is easily accessible within 10 minutes from Routes 128, 93, 28 and 1. Free parking is available in two lots on Tuttle Street, in the Church parking lot if there are no activities there, and on street after 5:30pm. Check out the MBTA or Hop Stop for additional public transit options including the less reliable/frequent 136 and 137 bus lines.

Check out the "Penny Lane" and "Nickel" Bars, the 9:09 and Beatles references.

More information at http://www.lauries909.com

See you there!

results.description:
The Boston Traders Meetup will be hosting a monthly options meeting to discuss options trading. This will be an informal gathering of folks who trade options who would like to share their knowledge and learn from each other. 


Beginners and experienced traders are welcome.


This event will be held on the Thursday evening before the monthly expiration Friday.* Holding the meeting at monthly expiration will allow people to discuss the trades that they have put on during the prior month and perhaps to share ideas for trades to put on in the next month. For weekly options traders, the monthly expiry is of little significance unto itself, but for the monthly options traders, it will hold more significance.

Mary-Lou Drozek will be moderating this meeting. She has been trading options for about 5 years and is happy to share ideas.

The meeting location is Panera Bread in Quincy, which has wifi and is visible from the North Quincy T stop on the Red Line. The location could possibly change, so please check back with the event page just to confirm the location before heading off to the meeting.

-------------------------------------------


* Meetup allows for scheduling "the third Thursday of the month," but not the "Thursday before the third Friday of the month," which is what we need. Using the Meetup scheduling system alone without intervention would mean that the third Thursday will be on expiration week except for those months starting on a Friday, as is the case in August of 2014; in which case, the meeting would fall a week after the monthly expiry week. We believe that we will be able to successfully manipulate this consideration in the meetup system to keep the meetings all on the Thursday evening before expiration Friday. If you see a meeting time that isn't the Thursday evening before expiration Friday, please let us know and we will correct it. Thank you.
results.how_to_find_us: Mary Lou will have a little red Boston Traders meetup table sign.
results.name: Options Monthly Meeting for Boston Traders Meetup

group.name: Boston Traders Meetup to Teach/Learn Trading Strategies

A free flowing social event where young people from all over the Boston area and all kinds of creative fields come together to socialize, drink, have fun, or whatever they see fit. 

It is not just important, but required, to register on the SoG website as well, as they've been gracious enough to offer their space, beer, wine, and food to us: https://www.societyofgrownups.com/events/boston-young-creatives-happy-hour-8202015

(Click the link, then "Add to Cart, $0" in the top right. There will be a quick check-in when you get to the venue. If spaces are still available you can register at the event.)

As always, Boston Young Creatives events invite all kinds of creatives to come together socialize. Writers, designers, developers, photographers, marketing specialists, etc.

Food and drinks are free! 

There is no agenda set for this event, but we are open to suggestions for future events.

Society of Grownups will happily describe what they do for anyone who asks, (and it's awesome), so please be gracious to our hosts. I strongly encourage you to check out their website, class offerings, and newsletter! www.SocietyOfGrownups.com

results.description:
NEXT LEVEL BUSINESS FORUM brings together business-owners, -coaches, and -service-providers, for enlightened discussions. Each participant, expert in his own field, benefits from the others’ perspectives.

Last week, we brought together coaches and entrepreneurs in one-on-one encounters, with insights later shared to everyone’s benefit.  It was so successful (by acclamation), that this week we thought of adding a little more excitement - A Competition!

THIS WEEK Business owners will compete to get to the Next Level. You’ll work with coaches in the room to define what next level looks like and discover steps to get there!

See more details in the agenda below.


--

GETTING HERE

Join us at MIT's Cambridge Innovation Center, 1 Broadway, Cambridge, 5th floor, Cozumel Room

• Register as a guest at the front desk and mention that you're attending our event on the 5th floor.

• Optionally: Meet us at Venture Cafe for networking before the event. Venture Cafe serves as a physical nexus for helping innovators and entrepreneurs find one another and collaborate to bring their dreams to reality.  All attendees to the Cafe should adhere to the Venture Cafe contributor model (http://vencaf.org/thursdaycafeboston/contributor-model/) and credo (http://vencaf.org/credo/). Learn more here: vencaf.org.

--


QUESTIONS? NEED HELP?

- Contact Ian: [masked], call or text: (802)[masked]

- Look for the Gain Street sign or anyone wearing a green Gain Street T-shirt in the Venture Cafe before our event


--

AGENDA

5 pm - Optional networking at Venture Cafe

*Venture Cafe is a members-only club for innovators. Learn more here: vencaf.org


6 pm - FREE PIZZA - Gain Street's Next Level Business Forum

To participate, please RSVP here, and arrive bearing enough copies of the text you’d like to discuss – whether prose or verse – for each participant to have their own. If you do not have the means to make copies of your writing, send the text by attachment to bostonpoetryunion (at) gmail (dot) com not later than the night before the workshop.

Occasionally, the moderator will invite a member or guest speaker to open the session with a brief talk on some literary topic. If you’re interested in delivering such a talk, email the organizers and let them know! Likewise let us know if you’d like to suggest a writing exercise or event.

http://www.icaboston.org/gedownload!/GreySeason_390.jpg?item_id=25891288

Returning performer Grey Season produced their first full-length LP in 2014 with Grammy-winning engineer Justin Guip at Levon Helm Studios in Woodstock, NY, and one would be hard-pressed to imagine a more ideal place for this project to come to fruition than this counter-culture musical mecca. All five band members perform vocals, with Jon Mills’s throaty voice in the lead. This layered, harmonic sound, combined with banjos and bouzoukis, give the group a decidedly nostalgic, bluegrass feel. Self-described as “perching harmonies atop a sound that is, in essence, folk wrapped in rock ’n’ roll,” Grey Season developed their musical style busking in the streets of Boston and Cambridge. It is impossible to not feel uplifted with their earnest and impassioned lyricism and bluesy guitar solos, combined to forge a bursting, spirited sound.

results.description:
NDE - Near Death Experiences 


Event held Thur Aug 20 at 6:30 pm



'The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.' - Albert Einstein 

 Have you had an NDE? Has your perception of life and death changed in any way? 

 Come tonight and share your experience with others. 

 The term 'Near Death Experience' was coined by Dr. Raymond Moody, who wrote the 1975 book 'Life After Life'. 

 If you've experienced an NDE, you are invited to share your story. 

Meet with other NDErs who understand the profound effects that NDEs have upon people's lives. 

What is a Near-Death Experience? According to IANDS, the International Association for Near-Death Studies, the definition of an NDE is : 'a profound psychological event that may occur to a person close to death or, if not near death, in a situation of physical or emotional crisis. Because it includes transcendental and mystical elements, an NDE is a powerful event of consciousness; it is not mental illness.'

Attendance is by donation.

This is a benefit event. All proceeds benefit Our Weeping Angel Foundation, a charitable, non-profit foundation that helps people find new pathways to healing and wholeness.

Preregistration required, as space is limited. 

Call Kathryn McGlynn:[masked]

Event held at :

The Healing Center at Our Weeping Angel Foundation

190 Old Derby St, Suite 100

Hingham, MA

More info:

http://www.hypnosis.ws

 -or-

http://www.localendar.com/public/km

results.description:
A regular mindfulness practice can have huge benefits in your life. Research shows that it can:

Reduce rumination, emotional reactivity, and stress while increasing immune function, focus, relationship satisfaction, empathy, compassion, self-insight and intuition!

During our hour together we'll begin with a relaxing body scan, followed by breathing meditation and metta (aka, loving kindness) practice. 

Metta is a form of mindfulness practice that focuses specifically on building compassion for ourselves and others. It helps give depth to our heart center and be able to do so with discernment. We observe our relationship to ourselves and others in the present moment, accepting it, without judgement. 

Beginners are welcome and encouraged! 

For those who do Reiki, you are welcome to stay for a Reiki share from 7:30-8:30. 

Christine can be reached at [masked] or[masked]-6040.

Donation only

Come join us this Thursday for coffee, code, and camaraderie.

General Description of our Code and Coffee Events:

Code & Coffee is a monthly opportunity for you to practice your skills, meet new friends, and get help if you need it. Bring your laptop, your recent projects, and your programming problems!

All are welcome regardless of gender or skill level, whether or not you've attended past Girl Develop It events. If you're a beginner, we'll be right there to help you work through your questions as needed.

Code & Coffee events are relaxed and informal, and are intended as a way for our community to work and play together while providing each other with ongoing support and feedback.

This event is free, though of course we encourage you to support our location host, Uno Due Go, with a purchase of coffee or a snack.

Feel free to come early, stay late, and/or drop in whenever you can. We can't wait to see you!

Summer's coming!  Let's add a night of cocktails and conversation at the waterfront for those hot summer nights!  You may live in Cambridge, Somerville or Charlestown, but this will give you an excuse to get out of your local neighborhood and head downtown!  

Join the New England Network for Women starting in May for a relaxed night of cocktails and conversation every third Thursday of the month at the InterContinental Boston Hotel on the waterfront.  Please come prepared to mingle with a fabulous group of empowering women who will share stories and tips on their business ventures! 


Whether you are networking to meet potential new clients, learn new tips and techniques from seasoned businesswomen, share ideas and experiences with open and like-minded women or just to meet new friends in the area, this is the group for you.  MEET AT THE OUTDOOR BAR & ASK THE HOST WHERE THE WOMEN'S MEETUP GROUP IS and bring your marketing materials and business cards to distribute.  If it's warm, we will move outdoors to the fabulous waterfront!  We aim to have a member speaker at each gathering, whom I have listed below.  If you would like to give a presentation at one of our meetings, please scroll down to  see if someone has been selected yet.  If not, you may inquire about being our speaker of the evening.  In order to speak, your membership dues must be current and you may pay your dues online or at your next meeting.  

Happy chatting and best wishes on your endeavors!  

As always, I welcome any questions you may have regarding our group or your business ventures! 

Stacey Mac, Owner

results.description:
Are there dreams and creative projects that you'd like to pursue or revisit? Are you asking, "What's next?" or “What do I really want?” in life. Would you like to be living more joyfully and fully expressed? 

In our Heartbeat Salon this evening… 

Kim Childs joins us for an introduction to The Artist's Way: A Spiritual Path to Higher Creativity, by Julia Cameron. 

Kim is an amazing life coach who will help guide you tonight to a life that reflects your true passions, talents and desires by using exercises from this popular and inspiring book. 

No artistic experience is required.
This workshop is simply for anyone who wants to live a more creative, self-designed life. You'll leave with ideas for eliminating unproductive habits and making time for what you truly love. 

To prepare, spend a few minutes considering these questions...

1) If ample money, time and other resources were readily available to and you didn't need to work for a living, how would you spend your time?

2) What activities consume the majority of your time, and do these activities reflect your true values? For extra prep, spend the week leading up to the workshop actually tracking where your time goes each day in a log or diary or chart.

~~ Bring a favorite notebook or journal if you have one.

Our Leader This Evening

Kim Childs is a Certified Positive Psychology Life and Career Coach, writer and Kripalu yoga teacher who leads workshops on Positive Psychology and The Artist's Way: A Spiritual Path to Higher Creativity. 

Kim's writing is featured in Chicken Soup for the Mother and Daughter Soul, Natural Awakenings magazine Kripalu’s Thrive blog and her own blog, A Pilgrim on the Path. Visit her at KimChilds.com.

[Parking and Travel Information: If you are driving and do not have a Somerville parking sticker, you can find free public parking on Somerville Ave. We're also accessible by public transportation - on the 87 and 83 bus lines or a 15 minute walk from the Red Line - Porter Sq. stop. The unit number is 9A - last one on the left.]

Links

Most Important:   
  * Calendar of Other Heartbeat Salons. 
  * HeartBeat Salon on FaceBook

results.description:
Hello all - our August session will hit on some of the HOTTEST topics in the world of OpenStack - namely containers and SDN! Join us and our co-sponsor Midokura to learn about Docker inside Openstack with production grade networking!


Openstack's Nova-Docker project has brought the reality of using containers inside an Openstack environment to everyone.  However the real problem of Neutron networking gets amplified when running lots of containers. Midokura will be providing a high level overview of how to use Nova-docker in a production environment by leveraging an opensource SDN solution called Midonet. 


The session will be led by Pino de Candia Chief Architect. 

Pino is a distributed systems expert who prior to architecting MidoNet, was busy at Amazon.com: building Dynamo, a NoSQL data store, and then managing an internal infrastructure software team focused on caching tools/systems.  Pino joined Midokura as a Software Engineer in late 2010. He helped build early versions of MidoNet and in 2011 became the manager of the Network Controller team, based in Barcelona.

Pino is responsible for the design and architecture of MidoNet.  He holds degrees in Computer Science (B.S. and M.Eng) from Cornell University.


Reminders:

• A light dinner and soft drinks will be provided ~ 6:30pm courtesy of Midokura, and we will kick off the sessions ~ 7:00pm.

• If you are interested in giving a Lightening Talk shoot us a note with a topic or just come to the session ready to speak!

• DON'T FORGET - for security reasons, the NERD center requires attendees to show a government issued photo ID in order to gain access into the building.

• Parking: Best option for parking is the NERD center parking garage which charges a flat rate after 4pm.
results.name: August OpenStack Meetup - Container networking inside Openstack using Midonet

results.description:
Have a child? Love a child? Then explore whether the local one-size-fits-few institutional school is the best place for your unique child to spend his formative years. You may possibly save a child from years of misery by finding an education alternative that better aligns with her nature and her personality.


A panel of experts will overview the most recent research on how children really learn, will detail new alternatives to institutional schooling, and will explore how well such alternatives successfully prepare teens for various future life paths, including college. 


Panelists:

* Ken Danford, Founder of NorthStar for Teens & Liberated Learners 
* Peter Gray, Boston College Professor and author of Free to Learn 
* Bill Hueur, Massachusetts Home Learning Association 
* Melissa Young, Admissions Officer at Mount Ida College 
* George Popham, Executive Director of Bay State Learning Center 
* Nancy Macdonald, Counselor at Bay State Learning Center

Join us to examine alternatives that just might give a child you love a gigantic head start on a life well lived! 

Please share this event with parents of children you love. 

And feel free to bring any interested teens and pre-teens ...
results.name: BSLC: Beyond Back-to-School: Alternatives to Institutional Schooling

TO REGISTER: http://www.circlesofwisdom.com/Advanced_eBook_Publishing_Mar_P6680.cfm

Join us for this eBook marketing and promotion class from our Heart-Centered Entrepreneur Series.

This course is for anyone who is planning, writing or has written an eBook. It is never too early to focus on marketing and promotion. Knowing who will buy your book, and how you’ll let them know about it, can give you the extra motivation to keep writing.

A marketing plan increases the odds you’ll have a bestseller. If you have published an eBook that is languishing in obscurity, proper promotion can bring sales back to life.

In this class we'll explore:

• The Benefits of Amazon’s KDP Select Program
• The Power of Reviews and How To Get Them
• Maximizing Pricing Promotions
• Expanding your eBook into other formats and retailers
• And much more

Join us for this empowering class as we dig deeper into the many advantages of eBook Publishing. 

TESTIMONIAL:
“Thank you for making techno-boobs, like me, feel welcome. Those of us who are teachers/poets/and the like, who have been waiting for someone like you to enable us to share our own unique gifts!”
~Nancy Anderson

results.description:
This monthly Meetup is a place to learn tunes and to play them slowly with other musicians. The tunes we play can be found here (Sheet Music). Since the list is getting large we have started selecting a rotating list of about ten tunes a month that we will definitely play so that new members can have a chance to play along without learning every tune right away. I update this list and email it monthly.

This is still a new group, and how we go about learning and playing is still a work in progress. But the goal is to have fun, and to get together with others who enjoy playing Irish music. Musicians of all levels are welcome. Since the goal here is for everyone to play, new members are encouraged to suggest tunes from the list and to suggest tunes to add to it. If the group as a whole knows a tune well, we'll play it slowly a couple of times, and then pick the tempo up a bit. 

Note on tempo

If you have gone to a typical Irish Session, we play a little faster than half that speed. But we'll start tunes slowly enough that everyone should be able to play along and learn by ear. If you haven't been to a session it is best to just show up and see if the tempo suits you :)  If you like metronomes...  For Reels (4/4), Hornpipes (4/4) and Polkas (2/4) set the metronome from 100 to 140 BPM and play one quarter note per click. For Double Jigs (6/8), Slip Jigs (9/8), and Single Jigs (12/8) set the metronome from 65 to 95 BPM and play three eighth notes per click. 

Directions

By Subway

The closest Red Line stop is Davis Square. From Davis Square you can either walk Northwest on Holland Street or take the bus (the 87 or the 88) to Teele Square. It is about a 10 minute walk between Davis and Teele Square. You can recognize Teele Square as a 5-way intersection with a small triangular island having a sign that says Teele Square. From Teele Square walk North on Curtiss Street for 3 blocks to Powder House Boulevard. The church is on the NE corner of the intersection.

By Bus

The 87, 88, and 89 buses stop in Teele Square.  The 87 bus runs between Lechmere Station (Green Line) and Arlington Center. The 88 bus runs between Lechmere Station (Green Line) and the Clarendon Hill Busway. The 89 bus runs between Sullivan Square (Orange Line) and the Clarendon Hill Busway. You'll want to get off the bus in Teele Square. From Teele Square walk North on Curtiss Street for 3 blocks to Powder House Boulevard. The church is on the NE corner of the intersection. The 77 bus runs between Harvard and Arlington Heights. You can walk from Mass Ave to Teele Square.

By Car

There is parking behind the West Somerville School that is one block West of the church. Parking there is available after 5PM even though the signs are somewhat ambiguous. From Powderhouse, turn onto Curtis, heading up the hill toward Tufts. Take the first left turn from Curtis onto Raymond Street. Ignore the NO LEFT TURN sign, as it is only in effect during rush hours. Raymond runs behind the school. The lot is about half a block down Raymond on the left.

Street parking is also available one block away on Packard Avenue from Powderhouse Blvd on the hill to the Tufts University campus. Pay attention to street signs to avoid parking in a restricted area.

See the map at: http://clarendonhillchurch.org/...

Accessibility

The church has a lift that requires someone to move from a wheelchair to the chair on the lift. I haven't had time to look at this yet, but I will have someone show it to me over the holidays.

results.description:
Cambridge meetup is back! We are going to have this event every other week!


http://www.championscambridge.com/


As Mike will be out of town and Suzanne may possibly also have to miss, Rachel will be also hosting the August 20 one.

As usual, please bring your driver's license or passport, if you would like to have alcohol. They are strict about IDs, No IDs no booze.  But people under 21 are welcome as well to this event  - Champions is almost as much a restaurant as a bar and you need not order a drink.

We don't have a pool of money for the event. You are responsible for your own consumption and please start and settle your own tab. Please bring your Cash or Credit/Debit card.

RSVP required. Please sign up. If you RSVP "Yes," but your plans change, please change your RSVP to "No" so others can sign up. Deadline for reservation is 3PM as we need to get an accurate head count for the reservation. On nights when we are expecting many people, we limit the RSVP number to 27. However, if you'd like to attend, but can't RSVP, send a message to Rachel Peters, as we may be able to get you in.

Champions is located at MIT/Kendall Sq. station. If you come from Boston side, you will see right in front of the T exit. It is part of the Marriott. Even though the address is listed as 50 Broadway, you can really only see it from the Main street side.

Having Meetup app on your smartphone is helpful, as we may update the event with a comment (for example, if we are in the separate room toward the Marriott lobby, as we are sometimes).
results.how_to_find_us: We usually make a reservation. Please RSVP by 3pm on the day of the event. Ask hostess for Japanese/English Meetup group.

results.description:
Revere Recreation is hosting Theatre Thursday's throughout the summer on Revere Beach (across from the station), and the August 20th showing is the Avengers.

Let's grab some beach chairs, blankets, and watch... What even happened in that movie? I saw it, but all the Avengers, Thor, Iron Man, Captain America flicks blend together in my mind. We can find out/rediscover the plot together.

Note: I will mostly likely arrive early to secure some space. Revere Beach is easily accessible through public transit at either the Revere Beach or Wonderland stops. Highly recommended! But there are also parking lots near Wonderland for those who prefer to drive to the beach.

Update: The film does not begin until after sunset, which is at after 7:30p, so 7PM is for dinner at nearby Thamor Da -- a delicious and fabulous hole-in-the-wall Cambodian spot a few blocks from the beach.
results.name: The Avengers (Outdoor Movie)

We'll run routes along the Charles River Greenway, Riverwalk, Newton and neighborhoods of Waltham, with options to extend for those who are looking to add distance (or end early!) Afterward we'll hop into the bar for post-run drinks. 

We meet in front of Shoppers Cafe and leave at 7:00p. There should be plenty of parking on the street and in the neighborhood. All levels are welcome, with a broad range of paces!

Runs are typically 3-5 miles. 

As our daylight becomes more limited, it is highly recommended to at least wear bright clothing, and also to consider bringing a reflective vest and/or lamp.  


See you there!

results.description:
Nick Vatterott, as seen on Late Night with Jimmy Fallon, Conan, Comedy Central, and other places on earth, will headline this month's edition of Strange Behavior at the historic Davis Square Theatre. Come spend a Thursday evening with one of NYC's top comedians as he performs with Jason Saenz (Montreal Just For Laughs) and Boston's own Guitler Raphael in this intimate, 175-seat blackbox theatre! Thursday, 8/20 features:
Guitler Raphael (Eugene Mirman Comedy Festival)
Jason Sáenz (AXS TV's Gotham Comedy Live)
Nick Vatterott (Conan, Comedy Central's 'The Half Hour')

For tix and info: http://bit.ly/1eAeNfM

Nick Vatterott Bio:

In 2010 The Hollywood Reporter named Nick Vatterott one of the “break-outs” at Montreal’s Just For Laughs Comedy Festival. Since then he has performed on Conan, Late Night with Jimmy Fallon and has a half hour special on Comedy Central. Nick was also a producer/writer/performer on Comedy Central’s stand-up sketch hybrid show Mash Up. His album FOR AMUSEMENT ONLY was named one of the albums of the year by Vulture, Laughspin and Splitsidder. He was the recipient of the prestigious Andy Kaufman Award in 2011 and before heading off to NYC, Chicago Magazine listed Nick as “The Funniest Man in Chicago.” Nick Vatterott’s comedy has been called high-energy, improvisational, unconventional, outside the box, but most of all hilarious!
results.name: Comedy Central's Nick Vatterott @ Davis Square Theatre!

results.description:
Hey everyone, it's August 20! H.P. Lovecraft's birthday! World Mosquito Day! And...SketchHaus! This week we're bringing you a triple threat of SketchHaus favorites, starting with Interesting Points - The Show! What is it about funny people that makes them interesting? Is it the things they know or the things they do? Is it the memories they share or the lies they make up? Whatever it is, it's hilarious. See what happens when your panel of comedians answers those questions, and find out what makes them interesting.

Then: Wild Memory Nation. Boston's best roving storytelling show, featuring scripted comedy monologues by some of the city's - and country's! - funniest people. Storytellers are given a single topic and then spin their hilarious tales out. Featured everywhere from Johnny D's Comedy Presents, Phoenix Landing Comedy, ImprovBoston, and the Women In Comedy Festival, Wild Memory Nation promises true stories, real funny. This month featuring Dave Bartlett, Johnny Burns, Mike Sweeney, and Adam Finne.

Stick around after that for Openhaus: Boston's best sketch open mic! Submit a sketch to be read by sketch performers! Don't have a sketch? Sign up to perform other people's sketches! It's a relaxed, supportive, eclectic, and fun time. Just show up and sign up!
results.name: Sketchhaus Presents: Interesting Points / Wild Memory Nation

results.description:
We've said it before and we'll say it again: Jack is back.

People have voted him the #1 DJ in the UK and that is no small feat. And why is that? He's good. Real good.

Not just a "techno guy" and by no means strictly a house head, Jack picked up all sorts of records as a young clerk in Glasgow. When starting a record label (Numbers) he paid no attention to the genre when bringing on new cuts--it was simply about quality. So the roster is a killer one: SBTRKT & Jessie Ware, Jamie XX, Sophie, Rustie, HudMo, etc. “I don’t think about music in terms of genre," he has said, I think about it in terms of energy levels."

And Make It New is all about it. Instead of asking what you'll hear tonight, wonder how high Jack is going to turn it up.

MAKE IT NEW WITH JACKMASTER
w/ resident DJs John Barera and Baltimoroder
Thu August 20
Middlesex Lounge
315 Mass Ave
Central Square, Cambridge
21+/9pm
$15 before 11 / $20
results.name: Make It New with Jackmaster (UK)

results.description:
INSTRUCTIONS ON RSVPs:

Read the entire description before you RSVP.

If you RSVP "YES" the next page displayed is the questions.

Answer all questions that are part of the RSVP.

Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event.  "WHY, YOU MAY ASK?" I'm assuming that if you cannot follow these simple instructions I DO NOT want to be out in the wilderness with you. ;)

If you RSVP from a mobile device the questions may not show up.

Use a computer, on the Upper Right of the page in the Green Box click "CHANGE RSVP", select "Yes" and click RSVP, the next page displayed is the questions.

IT IS YOUR RESPONSIBILITY TO LOGIN WITHIN THE NEXT THREE DAYS TO ANSWER THE QUESTIONS OR YOU WILL BE MOVED FROM "GOING" TO "NOT GOING".

If for some reason you cannot get the the Questions and you have REREAD these instructions and FOLLOWED them please send me an email.

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself or others at risk so consider this before you decide to participate.

What we are doing:

I have won the HalfDome Cable Permit Lottery and have two extra permits. I am putting this out for two people as a lottery.
Plan is to fly into San Francisco Friday August 21, pickup a camper van and drive to Yosemite. The permit is for Tuesday August 25. Sat, Sun, Mon will be for exploring Yosemite exact details to be planned as a group.
I have tickets already on southwest airlines out of Manchester at 5:50am. Check pricing on this flight as it would be good to fly out as a group. My wife and I are flying back Friday at 12pm though if you want to fly out Thursday we can drop you off at the airport. I have a tent sight reserved until Thursday and a camper van that fits 4 for driving, 2-3 sleeping . I have ordered a two man tent also.
Hike is 14.2 miles taking the Myst Trail (not Misty in August) with 4800' elevation gain. Last few hundred yards in steep and you actually use cables to  ascend. Those with vertigo will not like this ascent or descent. The trail is well maintained, mainly stairs made into switchbacks and nothing like the NorthEast.
We can share costs of campground and van. About $350 each or you can get your own transportation and share the tent site for $50. Notice there are no more campsites available for booking in the valley. All 300+ sites sold out in 6 minutes.
Please check flights to see if it fits your budget and if you can get time off.

 I will do the raffle May 2nd.

Note:


1. Our flight gets into San Francisco at 11:10am on Friday.  If you have frequent flier miles on another airline and can get a flight as close to this we could work with that.

2. We are still planning what to do Wednesday and Thursday.  We have a few months to plan so we could hit San Fran for a few days or somewhere on the coast. One way or the other we have to leave Yosemite Thursday.

3. If you want to go as a couple I am opening the raffle for that as well. Both need to be members of the group.  Both sign up as Plus one.  If you are the first name picked you both go. If you are the second neither goes and I select a third name.
results.name: Yosemite - HalfDome

results.description:
Co-work and meet with us every other Friday in Coolidge Corner. The goal of this phase is to build a strong core community and solicit a lot of input on what people want from our to-be-determined permanent space. We have this space from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM, so stop by and work with us anytime in that window. We will host lightening talks at 1:00 PM, so if you can only come for 30 minutes, that's the part you won't want to miss. A note on location: KI has been very gracious in inviting us to use a room in their building during this exploratory phase, even though we are not affiliated with them. Once we have a core community formed then we will secure our own permanent space. See you there!

UPDATE (sent via email 8/20):

LOGISTICAL NOTES:

1. FOOD - We are meeting in a synagogue that also hosts a preschool, which means it is a kosher and a nut-free facility. I will bring some light snacks to share with the group. If you choose to bring your own food, it must meet both the following standards: (a) is marked kosher with a hechsher or is a fresh fruit or vegetable, (b) does not contain nuts.

2. LOCATION & ENTRY - The building is at 384 Harvard St, Brookline, and we'll be in classroom #1 in the basement. Please enter through the door on Williams St. 

3. PARKING - If you are driving, there is a convenient public, metered parking lot off Fuller Street. 

4. SUMMER HEAT - The weather forecast is calling for a high of 82 degrees tomorrow. I stopped by the room today and it didn't feel too hot, but I'd suggest dressing comfortably for the temperature.

5. DISCUSSION - We'll hold a discussion at 1:00 PM. If you can't make it, don't worry, I'll send out notes and a follow up survey.
results.name: Coworking #1

group.name: Building a Coolidge Corner Coworking Community

results.description:
It's raining!! Oh noooooo!! Let's gather at Imagine this morning in Cambridge. I apologize for the change in location. There's also an admission fee of $10 (or less if you have a multipass). I hope that's okay for everyone. We'll meet on the top floor for a play date, and start potluck in the cafeteria, also on the top floor, at 11:00am. I hope to see you all there! -Michi

It's the end of summer! So sad... But let's celebrate the awesome connections we've built through this community, and the growing friendship of our little munchkins! Also both Ayako san and I are returning to work in September, so help us celebrate this occasion before panic sets in. Please bring some yummy food or drink to share. I'll bring plates, cups, utensils and napkins. Please bring your own serving utensils, though. As for food allergies, there's someone with dairy allergy (me) and another with egg allergy. Please feel free to share any other food restrictions in the comments section. 

Oh, and first timers are welcome to join in the celebration. I hope to see you all there! 

Michi

For those I saw last week, we talked about doing a swimming pool this week, and potluck the following week, but Ayako san can't make it the last week. I hope this works for everyone! This also may be the last meetup of the summer, as I may not be available on the 28th.
results.name: End of Summer Potluck

results.description:
Food Justice - Urban Agriculture - Nutrition

Bringing to the spotlight food justice, urban agriculture and the importance of nutrition, the Food for Us Forum will foster an exciting discussion to "grow" healthy food and healthy people. The saying "we are what we eat" has much wisdom in it. What we eat nourishes us, gives us energy, and gives us life. If the food we eat is not healthy, it can pull us down. If we do not give proper access to food to everyone, those people without access cannot remain healthy. In order to have a thriving city and healthy society, we all need good healthy food. Let's make sure we not only have a plan in place to do this, but a plan of action to carry it out. Find out how you can tap into the network of people, nonprofits, farmers, and chefs who are working to insure good food for us.

Food for Us panelist Othneil Uter, Urban Farmer, Boston Food Forest Coalition

Othneil "Utah" Uter grew up in the tropics on a 1-acre food forest that he helped create and maintain. His current forest garden in Grove Hall, which he frequently gives tours of, boasts over 50 different species of fruit and nut trees, including staples like grapes and apples, and exotics like figs and Arctic kiwi. Utah currently works for a non-profit organization in Roxbury. He is the co-organizer for the Greater Boston Permaculture Guild. He also is a member and avid contributor to Permies.com, the largest and most viewed permaculture website on the Internet. Utah brings his valuable vendor resources, cultivar selection knowledge, and permaculture design expertise to the BFFC.

For more details and a list of panelists, visit this link...

http://www.bostongreenfest.org/food4us.html

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/bgf2015-food-for-us-forum-registration-17954785246?ref=ebtn

For other GreenFest events throughout the weekend, visit this link...

http://www.bostongreenfest.org/index.html
results.name: Boston GreenFest: Food for Us Forum

results.description:
This walk is on a paved path through the woods. This path is stroller friendly or you could carry your child. It is a little hilly, but appropriate for most fitness levels. We alternate walks between the inner and outer loops which are both under 3 miles. It usually takes less than an hour. We walk past a playground too, so we could stop and play there for a while. Afterwards, we sit at the picnic tables under the trees by the visitor center and feed our babies, chat, etc. 

We will meet outside the visitor center in the upper parking lot on the Saugus side of the park, past the Kasabuski Skating Rink.  There are bathrooms with a changing table in the visitor center too.

Running late?  No prob. You can always meet up with us at the picnic tables next to the visitor center after we finish the walk. 

***By popular demand this is set as weekly event.  If the weather is bad we can change it to a different day or skip the week.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be the group with the strollers hanging out in front of the visitor center.

TURNING THOUGHTS INTO SONGS

A songwriting class for beginners

Learn simple ways you can access your deepest passions and beliefs and turn them into lyrics. In this class you will be involved in different songwriting activities and ice-breaking games. Let out what's inside of you. Put your thoughts and feelings to words and music!

All you need is a piece of paper and something to write with

WHEN: August 21, 2015 @4pm

WHERE: 62 Bow Street, Somerville, MA 

All ages welcome, for absolute beginners


FREE

QUESTIONS?: [masked]

results.description:
For New Members AND NON-Members:

For every sailor who walks through our door, start here! This FREE Orientation class will get you familiar with how everything works at CBI. The orientation class is the gateway to everything that CBI has to offer, whether you’re a seasoned sailor or brand new to boats. Done entirely on the dock, your orientation will include a guided tour of CBI’s boats and facilities, an overview of our classes and programs, as well as plenty of time to ask the questions that matter to you as a sailor. All orientations meet at the base of the American Flag Pole out on the dock, and runs for about half an hour. All are welcome to this class!


Afterwards, we invite you to meet one another and ask about other Orientation class attendees' prior experience with sailing. Perhaps you can find a friend to take the Beginner Sailing classes together with once you join. 

Friday Nights are also when CBI members go out for Informal Racing, so it is an exciting night to watch the sailors and learn more about how you can progress your skills after learning to sail. Certainly ask your Orientation instructor about the Friday Night Informal Racing and Informal Instruction if he or she does not mention it. If you have any questions, please feel free to post below!
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.community-boating.org/about-us/hours-and-directions/
results.name: FREE Orientation Class at Community Boating

results.description:
While Ludum Dare is typically an online event, many real world events happen around Ludum Dare. This is the Boston Ludum Dare 33 Kick-off Party sponsored by KAYAK. Space is limited and you'll need to be on the list to get in, so RSVP ASAP!

Come down to the new KAYAK Offices in Cambridge. Bring a laptop and your creativity. We'll provide pizza, beverages, wifi and some great workshops on game making. Everyone is welcome! Whether you've never made a game before or you're a longtime veteran, there will be people here that you can learn from. It takes all kinds of people to make a game. Artists, musicians, designers, programmers, writers, publishers are all invited! We'll help you get started and we'll help you find a great team to work with. https://www.eventbrite.com/e/ludum-dare-33-game-jam-kick-off-party-kayak-tickets-18020914039
