WBZ NewsRadio 1030 and the Department of Conservation and Recreation host the 30th Annual Free Fridays flicks movie series at the DCR Hatch Shell. Free Friday flicks start at dusk (8:15+ as the summer goes along) but activities and fun kick off at 6 p.m. on Fridays this summer!

Free Friday Flicks is a summertime tradition in Boston, attracting thousands of movie-goers to enjoy family-oriented feature length movies under the stars all summer long at DCR’s Hatch Shell in Boston! Bring a blanket or lawn chair, pack a picnic, and watch a movie with family and friends on Friday night for free! Movies begin at sundown, but arrive early to grab your spot on the lawn and enjoy free food samples, games, and giveaways with WBZ NewsRadio 1030 – the fun

July 17: Big Hero 6
July 24: E.T.
July 31: Indiana Jones & Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
August 7: Disney’s Cinderella
August 14: Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good Very Bad Day

http://boston.cbslocal.com/flicks/

results.description:
Art of Living Yoga is a holistic system for energizing and integrating the mind, body and spirit. Offered as a 4 day workshop, each 2.5 hour session offers a beautiful blend of yoga postures, breathing techniques, meditations and yogic knowledge.

Art of Living workshops and classes provide:

-A specific sequence of invigorating and soothing yoga postures that attend to your entire body -- all major muscle groups, joints and physiological systems. 
-A variety of breathing techniques that help with energy, focus, reducing anxiety and improving digestion. 
-Meditations to release stress and settle the mind. 
-Introduction to the ancient knowledge of yoga, applied for modern use. 
-A yoga home practice and instruction. 
-A community of yoga enthusiasts to practice with.

This course is ideal for all levels of yoga enthusiasts from beginners being introduced to yoga for the first time to advanced practitioners. Art of Living Yoga is a complete experience that will leave you feeling rejuvenated inside and out. 

"Yoga takes you close to your true nature. Yoga with its techniques helps you to harmonize with nature. Peace is our very nature, and yoga leads you to inner peace." -- Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder of the Art of Living Foundation

Friday, August 21st - 6:30pm-9:00pm

Saturday, August 22nd - 9:00am-12:00

Sunday, August 23rd - 9:00am-12:00

Monday, August 24th - 6:30pm-9:00pm

results.description:
Released twenty years ago to poor box office returns and indifferent reviews, John Carpenter's "In the Mouth of Madness" has slowly but surely been building up a fanbase that recognizes it as one of the director's more underrated films and a fantastic tribute to the stories of writer H.P. Lovecraft.

Sam Neill stars as John Trent, a cynical insurance investigator, who has been hired by Arcane Publishing to hunt down Sutter Cane, the publishing company's most successful writer. Trent's research soon leads him to Hobb's End, a town that technically shouldn't exist since it only appears in the stories that Cane writes. 

Weirdness and madness eventually ensues.

https://vimeo.com/85763778

To celebrate the movie's 20th anniversary and Lovecraft's 125th birthday this month, let's head over the the Brattle Theater in Cambridge, MA and check out "In the Mouth of Madness." The movie starts at 7 PM. The plan is to get to the theater fifteen minutes before the movie starts for tickets, snacks and seats. 


If you haven't been to the Brattle before, here is a link for directions by car or public transportation.

http://www.brattlefilm.org/about-2/directions-parking/

UPDATES: 

The screening of "In the Mouth of Madness" is only a couple of days away, and I'm pumped to finally see this on the big screen. Like a lot of people, I never got to see "Madness" during its brief run in theaters in 1995.  So seeing it theatrically should be a real treat.

Anyway, I just wanted to give the group some additional information about Friday. I plan on being outside the theater from about 6:30 to 6:50 PM. If you are looking for me, I will be holding a Meetup sign and wearing my Army of Darkness T-shirt. Come up and say "Hi!" I'd like to meet everyone in the group, if possible.

Ideally, I would like to have us sit together. I'm aiming for us all to go for balcony seats. However, if you can't sit that far back, no worries.

"Madness" is slightly over ninety minutes, and should wrap around 8:30ish. Once the movie wraps, try to exit on the right hand side of the theater where the bathrooms are. There is a short alleyway you will have to walk that leads towards a tree and bike rack. The group can assemble there.

Quite a few people in the BHS group wanted the opportunity to meet after "Madness" to discuss the film and to socialize with fellow horror fans. So, I have went ahead and booked the group a table at John Harvard's on 33 Dunster Street in Harvard Square.

If you have never been to John Harvard's, I have included a link to their page below which will give you all the info you will need regarding directions, menu, etc. But the place is only a brief walk away from the Brattle and is very close to the Harvard Square T stop.

https://www.johnharvards.com/locations/cambridge-ma/

If for any reason the group gets separated or you can't find the Meetup group, just head to John Harvard's after the movie  and ask for the table that is reserved for Jason and one of the staff will show you over.

I think I've covering everything, but if you have any other questions, just bring them up below. Thanks and see you all on Friday!
results.name: In the Mouth of Madness (1995)

results.description:
What happens when you bury clay vessels stuffed with salted cabbage brushed with chili paste for 3 months? You make Kimchi, the national food of Korea! Once a way to store vegetables (and meat) through the bitter winter months, fermentation can turn something inedible or difficult to digest into something nourishing and delicious. This program is one part lecture, one part skill sharing, one part tasting, and all parts conviviality. Learn how Asian communities preserve their food using salt, garlic, and spices, sample our Drumlin Farm kimchi, and take home your own fermented project to carry you through the winter months.

Bring your favorite knife if you have one. Jars will be provided. Meet at the Nature Center where you will be directed to the classroom space.

MAS Members: $30
Non-members: $36

Register here: http://bit.ly/1IXv9xe
(Registration is required)

For more information, contact:
[masked]
results.name: Fermentation Friday: Kimchi

results.description:
Sonoma and Napa Come to Massachusetts.

This will be a selective tour of California wines from the Sonoma and Napa region. An array of wines from several vineyards will be provided for you to taste, along with information about what makes each wine special. These will be wines that aren't typically sold in Massachusetts stores and range in price from $37-75. Join us as we explore wines from this world famous wine growing area with its diverse soils, topography and climate. 

$25 will include the cost of food and wine. Please bring four wine glasses.


Payment is due when you RSVP*.   Message Sarah or Jill if you have any questions.

We look forward to taking this tour with you! 

HOW TO PAY:  Preferred method is PayPal.  Sarah's PayPal email is: [masked].  If you don't have a PayPal account, it's very quick and easy to set up.  You don't have to fill in your bank account information (though they want you to).  You can just use a credit card.

* If you do not pay when you RSVP you will be moved to the wait list until payment is received.
results.name: California Dreaming

results.description:
Three hours of piano karaoke at The Green Room --- a wonderfully intimate venue in the heart of Union Square, Somerville.

Much more info here:

http://www.pianokaraoke.net

and

FAQ page

COST: $5+ requested donation at the door (to defray venue rental, piano tuning fees, Meetup organizer fees, etc.)

NOTE: The exterior door of The Green Room is a little tricky --- lift the handle UP instead of pulling it down!

PARKING: metered parking is available in the neighborhood. It's also OK to park in non-metered spots on residential streets if you do so for two hours or less. We've noted one ticket so far, so if you're staying longer than two hours, please plan on shifting your car's parking space before two hours go by.
results.name: Piano Karaoke at The Green Room

results.description:
We are on the second floor of the office/clubhouse building. If for some reason, the front door isn't propped open, come around the back of the clubhouse, up the outside back stairs to the second floor, where you can enter through the sliding glass door on the deck.

You CAN park along the road or in the "future resident" spots, but please do not take the spots in front of the building next door that are "resident only."

You can bring food and drink. If you want to grab dinner on the way in, there is a good and inexpensive Italian place almost across the street that also does take-out (Linguine's) and there is a Chipotle's nearby but expect to wait in line for 40 minutes on a Friday night. Feel free to bring your own games and snacks/drinks. We do have a small kitchen available to us.

Don't forget - Randy is paying Meetup like $15 a month to run this group. Consider chipping in a couple bucks each year to help defray his costs.
results.name: Marlborough Board Gaming

results.description:
Mmmmaven, an Electronic Music Production & DJ School hosts Boston Ableton User Group's monthly 'Ableton Live Meet-Up' featuring workshops & demonstrations from their skilled production instructors + special guests. These meet-ups are a great opportunity to network with other musicians, get involved in the scene, and learn something new from the Ableton gurus.

Demo Topics:

Sound Design w/ Hardware Synthesizers in Ableton Live​ w/ Mitchell Owens​


In today's world of electronic music production, a lot of producers reach for software to use in sound design and audio effects. However, many electronic producers find comfort in the hands-on experience of creating sound with a physical instrument like a synthesizer. Being able to step away from the computer and focus on a single device whose sole purpose is sound creation, offers a higher level of focus when it comes to sound design. During this workshop we will discuss the pros and cons of working with hardware and how to incorporate these instruments into our music production. We will also get an opportunity to get hands-on experience with the synths and learn about how they work and how to operate them for the purpose of making music.


Mitchell Owens is a guitar player, sound designer, and electronic composer/producer from Durham, NC. He attended Berklee College of Music right here in Boston and has over 5 years of experience with Ableton Live producing and performing music under the moniker Subalias, as well as doing sound design and soundtrack composition for independent films and animations. Mitchell’s music blends the organic and synthetic for a balanced fusion inspired by sample based Hip­Hop, Downtempo, House, Funk and R&B. He believes in freedom of creation and expression and likes to cater to each students specific needs to teach them the proper skills and techniques to achieve their musical goals.
results.name: Ableton Live Meet-Up (8/21) #FREE

results.description:
Hi Everyone,


I almost forgot about this concert. Phew.  I called up the Cabot, and they said to arrive an hour before  the concert (7 pm) if you can, as I believe that is when doors open, and seats are first come first serve. 

The concert begins at 8 pm and all adults tickets are $50 and can be purchased from http://thecabot.org/event.cfm?id=209479&cart

Please adjust your RSVP ASAP for this event.  Only say YES when you have purchased your ticket.  If you have RSVPed already but are not going, please update to NO.  Also, once you have purchased please comment on site that you have a ticket.

To get to the Cabot by transit from the city you can take the Newport/Rockport line from North Station  and get off at Beverly Stop (10 min walk to the Cabot), and the last train back looks to be approx 11:20 pm.   

http://www.mbta.com/schedules_and_maps/rail/lines/?route=NBRYROCK


For those not familiar of Bruce Cockburn he is a super singer songwriter and guitarist from Ottawa with his first Album in 1970.  From the Cabot:

The New York Times has called him a “virtuoso on guitar,” while Acoustic Guitar magazine placed him in the esteemed company of Andrés Segovia, Bill Frisell, and Django Reinhardt. Bruce Cockburn has released 31 albums, won 12 Juno Awards and 21 gold/platinum certifications. He is an Officer of the Order of Canada and recipient of the Governor General’s Performing Arts Award for Lifetime Artistic Achievement (Canada’s highest honour in the performing arts), along with being a member of the Canadian Music Hall of Fame, Canadian Broadcast Hall of Fame, and recipient of eight honorary doctorates from Universities throughout North America. Bernie Finkelstein, founder of True North Records, has been his management partner for 40 years.

I am planning on taking the train up to avoid North Shore traffic and grab a bite to eat prior to the 7 pm door openings. If there are others with the same idea, I was thinking Little Italy pizza just down the street for 6 (locals can advise me if there is anything better or a better place to meetup prior).  If people can't make it beforehand we can meet at the door and hopefully go in together.  I'll update closer to the date how to find me.  

http://www.littleitalybeverly.com/

Don't wait to grab your tickets!  And let me know if you have any questions.

Cheers

Bruce (not Cockburn)
results.how_to_find_us: TBD
results.name: Bruce Cockburn Summer Concert

results.description:
PLEASE DO NOT DOUBLE RSVP! ----PLEASE RSVP IN ONE GROUP ONLY!! 

Join the legendary crazy dancing at our Mix +Mingle Meetup Private Party for 120+ members with our own DJ, dance area, 2 bars +apps/food from 7-9PM.

7-9PM is the Social Mixer which the best because it allows you to get to know your fellow Meetup members. After 9PM the crazy dancing + loud music starts so please do not complain, since members come to dance to loud music after 9PM.

Bonus FREE KARAOKE on 1st  floor if you want to kick it KARAOKE style.

Its the party everyone loves since its he starting point for thousands of new friendships, real long term relationships and 57+ marriages. Remember this is not a Singles Party it's a Social party.

The BEST part!...Come between 7 and 8:20PM to get 1 included (FREE) drink ticket good for any beer, wine, or mixed drink! (Sorry no shots or top-shelf liquor). This 1 Drink ticket will expire at 8:20PM sharp!!.....Please don't forget to TIP your bartender for the included drink! 

When you arrive please head upstairs, (please don't block the stairway). Meet/greet Biagio, say your first name, what group you're with, pay with a $10 bill in hand at the top of the stairs (no $1 or $5 bills, please). You'll get a wrist bands to  so you can go upstairs and downstairs.

1. Biagio collects $10 cash from everyone, but the invited Larger Meetup Group Head Organizers and some of the  Social Fun Organizers..

2. After 9 PM you'll have to pay the bar's cover charge, so stretch your dollar and come before 9PM. If you get in before 9PM you ONLY have to pay $10 to Biagio.

I hope you can all join us for this blast of a party. It should be fun so thanks and enjoy life!..........Ciao, Biagio (a new dad)

==========================================================

Parking for this event: Street parking can be tough so you can try it and of course it's hit or miss. Your best bet it take the T.

The closet T stop is the Aquarium stop on the Blue line, next would be State Street stop on the Orange line.

If you really must drive in and park then there is $10 Parking after 5PM and on weekends at International Place Garage . There is a coupon that lowers it to $7 but this  $7 coupon is accepted at Pay Station in building lobby ONLY.  http://bostonparking.spplus.com/Boston-1-International-Place-Parking.html
results.how_to_find_us: We rented the whole 2nd floor of the Wild Rover to make this an awesome private party Look for Biagio at the top of the stairs.

results.description:
Let's have dinner and drinks at John Harvard's, a Microbrew in Harvard Square!

As I will need to make reservations, please RSVP by about 3PM on that Friday so I can get a reasonably accurate headcount.

As they do serve alcohol, ABSOLUTELY BRING ID IF YOU'RE PLANNING TO BUY ALCOHOL!! Also, remember to bring your favorite form of payment in order to cover your own tab at the end.

The John Harvard Brewery is a one-minute walk south of the Harvard Square station (on the Red Line) on Dunster Street.
results.name: Dinner and Drinks in Harvard Square

results.description:
Lets chat over coffee or tea at Pete's and go for a walk on the bike path.
if it rains, no walk, just coffee!
results.name: Get together at Pete's Coffee and walk

results.description:
Please join us for an introductory crystals class on Friday, August 21, 2015, in the Library of the Democracy Center, from 7-9pm.

About crystals: Throughout our history, mankind has utilized crystals and gemstones for their spiritual, therapeutic, and aesthetic attributes. In some cultures, people find them helpful warding off negative energies, promoting good fortune, or to sneak a glimpse into the future events. Others have learned to harness their inherent energies, to call upon divine influences during summoning or ritual incantations For whatever the purpose, crystals have continued to bridge our world to the supernatural. In this class you will learn crystal basics for magical and healing purposes and discuss the impact they could have in your life and the environment around you.

This class is by donation, please give what you can to cover the cost of the rental space and supplies. 

Hosted by Michael Damion

About Michael: I’ve have been enthralled with occult practices most my life. I started when I was very young, after discovering my dreams have the tendency of coming true. This exposure to precognition is what drove my interest into the paranormal, and has continued to be a passion of mine decades later. This journey has awakened my awareness to crystal vibrations, which I train to enhance, restore, and heal my own bio-rhythm to levels of higher capacity. I would like to host this class on crystal basics to share the knowledge and experience I’ve learned through my expedition into the realm of mystical arts.
results.name: Crystal Class - Basics

results.description: Wow; don't miss this! Come enjoy the sacred sounds of Didgeridoo, Tibetan singing bowl, tingsha, toning, Native American flute, and hoop drum for an evening of sound healing with Greg Sheridan. Greg plays for the group and also comes by to bring sounds close you your own auric field. The drum and didgeridoo bring your energy to a higher and more open state and your cells come into vibational balance. This event promises to bring smiles, awe and wonder as Greg brings his energy and sound healing skills to the group and each person.
results.name: Sound Healing with didgeridoo, drum & more with Greg Sheridan

group.name: The Salem MA Meditation Meetup Group

results.description:
Meetup at MetroRock Gym in Everett, offering both toprope and lead


Meet at the left-side hexagonal picnic table next to the bench and cubbies.

I (Jens) will go up to the picnic table area from 7 - 7:15 PM to meet people who prefer to show up at the regular MeetUp time. Please check  the whiteboard near the bathrooms for a description of what I'm wearing. If anyone else arrives early, please write "MEETUP" and your name & what you are wearing on the Whiteboard.

If you have not already done so, please post a clear face picture of yourself on your profile so that I and other members can recognize you.

If arriving later, just come find us on the walls. Hopefully you can recognize me (see "Event Host" right) from my picture.

If you've never climbed here before, you'll need to take & pass a belay test for rope climbing. Call the gym or see the website below for more info. Full-access Day Pass $22. Bouldering-Only Pass $18. Free pizza for students.

More info and directions: http://www.metrorock.com/
results.how_to_find_us: At the picknic table next to the cubbies
results.name: MetroRock FRIDAY

results.description:
5/21/15 UPDATE:  SINCE WE ONLY HAVE 16 MEMBERS SIGNED UP, THEY ARE GIVING US ANOTHER 1 - 2 WEEKS TO REACH 20 MEMBERS, THIS INSURES OUR GROUP RATE WITH NO PER TICKET CHARGE.  ANYONE ELSE INTERESTED?


Red Sox vs. Royals

Let's get together and watch the Sox.  We have great seats together behind home plate, Infield Grandstands, Section 22.  The cost is $63.40 each.  We need to collect the payment NOW in order for them to hold our seats.

Sign up on meetup, 'RSVP yes' if you would like to attend and ONLY if you send a <a>check ASAP</a> to:


Larry Sussman,   105 Black Bear Drive, #1727, Waltham, MA., 02451 by Friday, May 15.  .Please make the check out to; Boston Chapter, ASGA

BY 5/23/15, Friday.

Once we receive the checks , we can purchase the tickets.  I will maintain a waitlist, just in case something comes up after the tickets are purchased and you need to sell your <a>ticket</a>.

Bonus FREE KARAOKE on 1st  floor if you want to kick it KARAOKE style.

Its the party everyone loves since its he starting point for thousands of new friendships, real long term relationships and 57+ marriages. Remember this is not a Singles Party it's a Social party.

The BEST part!...Come between 7 and 8:20PM to get 1 included (FREE) drink ticket good for any beer, wine, or mixed drink! (Sorry no shots or top-shelf liquor). This 1 Drink ticket will expire at 8:20PM sharp!!.....Please don't forget to TIP your bartender for the included drink! 

When you arrive please head upstairs, (please don't block the stairway). Meet/greet Biagio, say your first name, what group you're with, pay with a $10 bill in hand at the top of the stairs (no $1 or $5 bills, please). You'll get a wrist bands to  so you can go upstairs and downstairs.

1. Biagio collects $10 cash from everyone, but the invited Larger Meetup Group Head Organizers and some of the  Social Fun Organizers..

2. After 9 PM you'll have to pay the bar's cover charge, so stretch your dollar and come before 9PM. If you get in before 9PM you ONLY have to pay $10 to Biagio.

I hope you can all join us for this blast of a party. It should be fun so thanks and enjoy life!..........Ciao, Biagio (a new dad)

==========================================================

Parking for this event: Street parking can be tough so you can try it and of course it's hit or miss. Your best bet it take the T.

The closet T stop is the Aquarium stop on the Blue line, next would be State Street stop on the Orange line.

If you really must drive in and park then there is $10 Parking after 5PM and on weekends at International Place Garage . There is a coupon that lowers it to $7 but this  $7 coupon is accepted at Pay Station in building lobby ONLY.  http://bostonparking.spplus.com/Boston-1-International-Place-Parking.html

results.description:
Autumn Sonata - advanced tickets

 by Ingmar Bergman (1978, 99 min., 35mm). Ingrid Bergman returned to her native Sweden to make her last feature film with the other legendary Bergman, Ingmar. After neglecting her children for many years, world famous pianist Charlotte (Bergman) visits her daughter Eva (Liv Ullmann) in her home. To her surprise she finds her other daughter, Helena (Lena Nyman), there as well. Helena is mentally disabled, and Eva has taken Helena out of the institution where their mother had placed her. The tension between Charlotte and Eva builds slowly, until a late-night conversation releases all the things they have wanted to tell each other. Ingrid Bergman received an Academy Award nomination for Best Actress.  In Swedish and English with English subtitles.

After close of credits, we'll gather in the hallway and go to UNO for a late-night conversation...

See you at the movies,

John
results.how_to_find_us: John will gather the group in the hallway after close of credits to go to UNO for treats and tralk
results.name: THE FILMS OF INGRID BERGMAN: AUTUMN SONATA

results.description:
Friday nights are generally for more experienced students, as we work through some different parts of Fiore's works in a more open format.  New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (c[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.
results.how_to_find_us: Come around to the right side of the building.  The stairs will bring you to the door.
results.name: (Newton) Intermediate Longsword, Dagger and Grappling

group.name: Boston Armizare -- Historical Swordplay and More!

results.description:
The presence of the Angelic Realm is among us all, in every moment. 

They are here to support us, to guide us, to heal us while we are here on this physical plane. 

Many experience signs from the angels - feathers, pennies, 444 (triple or reoccurring numbers), a song on the radio at just the right moment, a call from someone you we just thinking about are just a few.

We must remember as part of our choice to be here now, we were given divine free will in every moment to decide our next step, our thoughts, and our actions (and re-actions) in regards to our life.  Your angels want for you to call on them, to talk to them, to ask for their support and guidance - and then and only then can they attend to you and your life. 

During this group we will call upon the Angelic Realm to support us and guide us through the process of Cutting the Cords to things, people, places, relationships, patterns, etc...that no longer serve us. We will invoke the energies of Archangel Michael to assist us in cutting cords as he is the Master Angel of this process. 

We will then invoke the energies of Archangel Raphael - the Master Angel of Healing to heal all the those parts where the cords have been cut!  Filling us with light and love. We will also ask AA Raphael to heal our hearts of all hurts and past heartache, including those hurts that have been self-inflicted! 

This will open you to a new, higher vibration and energies as you will then be able to 'hold' more light.  You will be in direct communion with your Angelic Support Team and ask for any specific guidance or questions that you may have.

Only high frequency loving energies will be called upon, so you will be safe and protected within this sacred space. 

This is a great way to connect with your personal angelic support team, re-connect with your guardian angels or simply experience the loving and supportive energies of the angels!

Also a great space to connect with other spiritually minded individuals!

Energy Exchange $10

Nicol will be leading this group.

www.essencehealing.net to learn more about Essence of Healing
results.name: Angel Healing Circle - Cutting Cords!

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

8:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

8:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

8:20 - Play!!!!!!

10:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!

venue.name: Gilliland Observatory of the Museum of Science Parking Garage

results.description:
Fridays, March – mid-November | 8:30 – 10:00 pm
Offering Format: Public Event
Recommended for grades Pre-K – 12 and adults
Museum of Science
Free

Did you know that the Museum offers our starry-eyed public a free evening full of astronomy-themed fun on weather-cooperative Fridays?

Between 8:30pm and 10pm each Friday, weather-permitting, visit the Gilliland Observatory on the roof of the Museum’s parking garage. On clear nights, you can view stars, planets, the Moon, and other astronomical phenomena. On cloudy nights, tour the inside of our Observatory, and participate in astronomy-related activities run by our knowledgeable staff.

This program does not run on nights when the weather is inclement. For more details, and to find out if Astronomy After Hours is running on a given Friday, call our hotline,[masked]-0267. We update each Friday by 5:30pm with the evening’s plans.

Astronomy After Hours runs seasonally, from the first Friday in March to the last Friday before Thanksgiving. Admission is free thanks to the generosity of the Lowell Institute (parking charges still apply).

Thanks to Don Doughty for letting us know about the museum.

Source: http://www.mos.org/public-events/astronomy-after-hours
results.name: Astronomy After Hours - Museum of Science

results.description:
Welcome future dance-a-holics!! Come dance with us again THIS FRIDAY! If you want to learn to social dance and have a blast while doing it, please join me for a beginner west coast swing class from 8:30-9:15pm (Experienced with WCS? Join Marcus Schwarz for the Intermediate class at 8:30!). If you like it and feel like sticking around, there is a west coast social dance from 9:15-11pm.

You don't need a partner.

You don't need to have any previous dance experience.

You can have two left feet.

This is all about having a blast while learning something new that you can actually use in your real life!

WHAT IS WEST COAST SWING?

West Coast Swing (WCS) is a modern, partnered social dance done all over the world.

It is danced to a wide variety of music, including R&B, Rock, Blues, and Lyrical: exactly what’s on the radio today and at functions you attend!

It fits in small spaces like bars, crowded dance floors—even your living room.

You do not need a partner to get started.  Most people come by themselves or with friends.

Once you’re hooked, there are places to dance WCS every night of the week in the Boston area.

People of all ages dance WCS.
results.name: Beginner & Intermediate West Coast Swing Class & Social Dance!

results.description:
All the Live music lovers of Boston Area know this little gem in Central Square. I was there last week when The Party Factor played, I danced all night with some friends and a bunch of random people ( probably out Finding Pedro)!

I am organizing this meetup here to let ya'll in on a secret, if you have never been, this place is a gem and if you have been here before going with a bunch of Pedro's Friends will be crazy fun!

Cantab is not your typical "lounge", it does not have couches, the bartenders are swamped for the most part (they do have waitresses to bring drinks to the tables), overall decor is diveish, but the music is always top notch and the ambiance is electric especially once the crowd starts pouring in around 10:30PM. I have spent several Weekend/Weeknights in this place just listening to music and busting some moves!

THERE IS A COVER of $6.00, but its totally worth it, considering the fact that drinks are cheap!It's cash only. 

Myself and possibly a few other members will wait for everyone outside the lounge and we can enter as a group , before the band starts. After the night progresses, the place will be packed, the Boston Soul Revue are playing that night starting 9:00PM http://www.bostonsoulrevue.com/.

There is a separate space downstairs I believe playing EDM/HOUSE , the cover for it is generally higher, but I don't think venutring there will be a necessity.
results.name: Live music at Cantab Lounge

results.description:
Please note the change of time. We are starting earlier in the morning to finish the run before it gets hot :-).  

Group run logistics: Please come prepared for a short run (or run/walk). Leave your bags, etc. at home or in your car so that you can run easily. Please make sure to arrive 10 minutes early to look for parking, find the location, etc. 
Coach will brief you at the beginning of the run about the distance and direct you through stretching exercises. It is absolutely OK to run/walk in the beginning. Many of us are first-time runners. So please don’t be shy :-). 

Program details:  TeamAIDAsha is a beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training and fund-raising program. We train runners for their full or half marathon races and runners raise donations for AID and Asha. Both beginner and experienced runners are welcome. Anyone is welcome to RSVP and join us for the group runs up to four time with no obligations. We request formal registrations after attending four group runs.

If you missed the information session you can get an overview of this training and fund-raising program from here.

Looking for more runners: We are always looking for more runners. If any of your friends, family members or colleagues to give us a try and join this meetup group.


Waiver: Lawyers make us do this :-).  By running with TeamAIDAsha program you are agreeing to our official waiver at: http://www.teamaidasha.org/waiver.html


About AID-Boston

Association for India's Development (AID) is a non-profit, volunteer movement committed to promoting sustainable, equitable and just development, especially at India’s grassroots. We meet once a week at MIT. Anyone is welcome to attend. Visit AID-Boston at: www.aidboston.org

About Asha-MIT

Asha tries to catalyze socio-economic change in India through education of underprivileged children. We meet once a month at MIT. Anyone is welcome to attend. Visit Asha Boston/MIT at: http://www.ashanet.org/mit/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a group of runners and volunteers
results.name: Beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training run

results.description:
We will run down Comm Ave in the carriage lane to the Chestnut Hill/BC reservoir, with the option to run around the reservoir before turning around. This is an out and back course so the distance is flexible - you can run however many miles you want!  There are some hills - we will run 3 of the 4 Newton Hills along the Boston Marathon course.

Meet outside at the tables next to Bruegger's and the ATM. 

The pace will vary depending on who shows up.  If there is a wide range of paces, we frequently end up splitting into smaller groups based on pace.  Even if your pace doesn't "match up" with anyone else, meeting up with the group and starting the run with everyone is a great way to get yourself out of bed on those early Saturday mornings!
results.name: Comm Ave long run  8-15+ miles

results.description:
Event Organizer: Lisa Robbins,[masked]

Sign-up Procedure


If you are interested in participating in this event, sign up for the waiting list. I will add people that (1) answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process and (2) have done hikes of comparable challenge within the past three months.

=========================

Read this hike's entire description and make sure you answer all of the questions in the pop-up box that appears when you RSVP.  The questions might not show up if you register from a phone or tablet, so if you don't see them, you will need to use a computer.

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared, you put yourself and others at risk. Consider this before you sign up.

=========================

What We're Doing

We're climbing Mt. Jefferson from the east, via the Great Gulf Wilderness and the Six Husbands Trail, named for Pocasset queen Weetamo's apparently less-than-lucky spouses. Ladders, scrambles and high perches have earned this trail a place on the "Terrifying 25" list and will make for an  entertaining ascent. After summiting Jefferson, we'll descend along the steep, scenic cascades of the Sphinx Trail.

Scheduling Note: This is a repost from Sunday, July 26, when the weather did not cooperate with our plans. The rain date for this posting is Sunday, August 23.

Stats

This is a strenuous hike on steep terrain.

Distance: 14.6 miles 
Elevation gain: 4,804 feet 
Estimated hiking time, a.k.a. "book" time: 9 hours, 45 minutes. This estimate doesn't include breaks.  We might be out longer, especially given Six Husbands' jungle gym qualities.

We could alter our plans because of fatigue, weather, and/or other conditions. There is no guarantee we will complete the entire event as described here.

No guests are permitted. No dogs are permitted because of the trail's steepness and ladders.

Max group size will be 10, per wilderness area regs.

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you expect us to constantly wait for you while you putter around.

What to Bring

The usual for a summer hike: 2-3 liters of water, lunch, snacks, rain/wind protection, layers for cooler temps, headlamps (cuz you never know). Use this list to make sure you have what you need:

http://files.meetup.com/492954/Three_Season_Dayhike_gear_list.pdf **

**Exception to this list: No cotton.


There is water along our route, so you might want to bring a lightweight treatment system for refills.

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment. Test and adjust it prior to the trip. 

Directions 

We'll meet in the parking lot at the Great Gulf Trailhead, just off the west side of Rte. 16, near from Camp Dodge. There's a WMNF sign at the turn off.

According to Google Maps, the distance from Boston is 183 miles and the drive time is about 3 hours. Please give yourself some wiggle room to get there on time!

For customizable driving directions:

<a>https://www.google.com/maps/dir//44.3101194,-71.2200819/@43.3738261,-72.7444505,8z/data=!4m2!4m1!3e0</a>;

While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride.

Weather

Dangerous weather conditions will cancel this event. I'll post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants.

Use the following links for summit weather forecasts:

http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=44.30450981400048&lon=-71.31757999099966&site=all&smap=1#.VabjAs74tFI 

http://www.mountwashington.org/weather/summit_forecast.php 

http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Mt-Jefferson/forecasts/1742

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
results.name: Mt. Jefferson via Six Husbands (advanced)

results.description:
Event Organizer: Michael Blair @ (978)[masked]

=====

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all of the questions that are part of the process. Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event.

Answers DO NOT carry over from one event to another so you must answer them for EACH EVENT. Also, questions might not show up if you RSVP from a phone or tablet so if you don't see them you will need to use a computer.

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself and others at risk. Consider this before you RSVP.

=== What We're Doing ===

The plan is to hike to three of the 4,000 footers in New Hampshire - Jefferson, Adams, and Madison. We will use Caps Ridge Trail, Gulfside Trail, and Valley Way Trail on this one-way hike. Our day will begin at the highest trailhead in the White Mountains - Caps Ridge at 3,008 feet. We will be above treeline most of the day and we will stop at the AMC Madison Springs Hut along the way.

If you are interested in participating in this event sign up for the waiting list. I will add people that (1) answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process and (2) have done similar hikes within the past three months.


Group size will be limited to 12 people.

Use this link for more information about where we are going and how we will get there:


http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/3-Mt-Jefferson-5712


http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/2-Mt-Adams-5774--5-Mt-Madison-5367

Guests aren't permitted. Everyone must be a member of the group.

Dogs are only permitted with prior approval of the event organizer.

=== Trip Summary ===

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you.

On this moderate pace (~2.0 MPH) trip we will hike about 10.0 miles and climb about 4,400 feet. It should take an average hiker about 7 hours 30 minutes to complete. This event is considered ADVANCED because of the pace, distance, and elevation gain.

Dangerous weather conditions will cancel this event - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants. Use this link for the current weather forecast:

http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lon=-71.31686&lat=44.30458#.VbV4eHjuh_Y


=== What to Bring ===


Use this link for a list of items needed for most three-season day hikes:

http://files.meetup.com/492954/Three_Season_Dayhike_gear_list.pdf 

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

=== Directions ===

We will meet at the Appalachia Parking Lot on the south side of Route 2 near Gorham, NH, Since this is where we will end our hike we will leave a few cars their and drive to where will begin our hike. According to Google Maps this spot is about 170 miles from Boston and it will take about 2 hours 43 minutes to drive there.

Here is a link to a customizable map: 

https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Boston,+MA/44.371467,-71.289381/@43.3643209,-72.5561113,8z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m8!4m7!1m5!1m1!1s0x89e3652d0d3d311b:0x787cbf240162e8a0!2m2!1d-71.0588801!2d42.3600825!1m0


While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride.

=== Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer ===

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

results.description:
Saturday, August 22
Whipple Hill and Locke Farm
Whipple Hill conservation area in Lexington and Winchester includes many habitats within its 130-odd acres. We’ll see what late summer has to offer in the woods around Whipple Hill (at 374 feet, the highest point in Lexington) and in the lowland area around Locke Pond. Beyond the pond is a trail that extends to the Arlington border. Interspersed with the oak/maple/hickory forest along this trail are rocky outcrops, streams and pine forest. At the end of the walk, we’ll stop at the adjoining Wright Locke Farm, an 18th century historic farm where there will be chickens. Meet in the parking lot across from the fire station at Mullen playground, off of Lockeland Road in Winchester. 8:00-10:00AM Andrea Golden
results.name: Birding Whipple Hill and Locke Farm

The third part of the 3 part series Introduction to Sea Kayaking. This session will concentrate on paddling in conditions. Techniques for handling wind, waves, and current will be emphasized such as edging, asymmetric paddling, ruddering, crossing eddy lines, and the proper use of skeg in wind. Possible venues are Cohasset Harbor or Woods Hole, depending on the group and the weather.

The start time and location on meetup are approximate. To attend this paddle, you *must* register with Dennis at http://activities.outdoors.org/search/index.cfm/action/details/id/82831

We'll cover the basics of the Python programming language, discuss the pros and cons of using Python as well as some of the major pitfalls in getting started. results.description:
Enjoy a one-day retreat as we journey through the month of Elul preceding Rosh HaShanah. We'll begin with a meditative walk and outdoor service that will include reading of the Torah and an in-depth Torah discussion. Our service will be followed by a picnic lunch, a special activity, and a longer walk. The day will be led by Rabbi Katy Allen of Ma'yan Tikvah. Bring a chair you can carry a short distance, a water bottle, something to share for lunch, your own dishes and utensils, and a favorite reading about teshuvah or nature. In case of rain, we will hold the service, Torah discussion, and lunch at a private home. An optional donation of $9-36 is invited. For more information on donations, go to www.mayantikvah.org/shabbat-holidays-and-classes/.

If you can offer a ride for someone coming by T to either Alewife, Riverside, or Waltham, please be in touch. Thanks.

results.description:
We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (circa[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

See you there!

Please park in our designated spots, and remember that this may be several cars deep.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us in the triangle between Magnolia and Thorndike Fields, just off the bike path.
results.name: (Cambridge) - Intermediate Swordplay, Dagger and Grappling

ALL ABILITY LEVELS WELCOME!!!

I have booked a room at the Chelmsford Public Library and asked Craig Forman to speak to us about Options trading the Tastytrade way. Below is a description of Craig's background. We can have additional discussion around trading ideas if time permits. I have booked the room from 10am-12:30pm.

Craig Forman holds advanced degrees in Electrical Engineering as well as an MBA. He has been a self-
directed investor for over 30 years, occasionally using fund managers to manage a portion of his
portfolio. After the financial meltdown of 2008, and seeing the miserable performance (relative to the
S&P 500) of the managed portfolio, Craig began to educate himself on strategies to reduce risk and
increase returns by using options. After the corporation he worked for was acquired in 2009, Craig
decided to leave the corporate world to concentrate full time on trading, education, and personal
wealth management. The game changer for Craig was the launch of the tastytrade Financial Media
Network in 2011. Craig follows the basic tastytrade principles for managing his personal portfolio, and
teaches a courses in investing at the Cambridge Center for Adult Education and Newton Community
Education He is using the tastytrade methods daily to reduce risk and increase probability of profit in
his personal portfolio.

McCarthy Meeting Room
25 Boston Road
Chelmsford, MA USA 01824

results.description:
(A set of 6 Saturday classes)

Rapier – The word evokes images of duels, high adventure, and swashbuckling. Have you had a desire to learn how these swords were used in combat during the Renaissance era? Much more than shouting “En Garde!” and assuming a guard stance; competent warriors fought with systems that included various ways to attack and defend, footwork, timing, and even rules of dueling, all based on a sophisticated understanding of body mechanics, mathematics and philosophy.

The 16th century was a period of change for the sword. No longer relegated to the battlefield; the sword changed as its wear became commonplace in society. Blades slimmed and guards became more elaborate as the sword evolved into a nimble thrusting weapon worn by commoner and noble alike. As a result, a number of fencing schools opened to capitalize on their growing popularity. The golden age of rapier study dawned around 1550; numerous masters publishing fencing system manuals over the century to follow, with topics including rapier, off-hand companions such as the dagger, buckler and cape, long sword, quarterstaff, pole arm, dagger alone, and grappling.

Our six-week Novice Rapier course will introduce the basic techniques and vocabulary of rapier fencing, enabling students to begin their study of period combat and the Art of Defence. The course will be taught by Charles and Robert, rapier scholars and Schole of Defence instructors.  No prior training needed; all class equipment is provided.

We invite you to come join the scholars and combatants of our Schole!

(The price shown is for the set of all six classes [August 22, 29, and September 5, 12, 19 and, 26] and membership and registration.  Classes are not offered separately.  Class materials will be sent via email before the first session.)

results.description:
Hello All,
Monthly walk at Borderlands.   I'd like to do the Pond Walk/Tisdale Road which is about 3.1 miles. If anyone is interested afterwards, we can also walk the short but more challenging West Side Trail(about 20-25 min).   Please be advised that parking has increased from $2 to $5 for residents, $6 for non-residents. :( The walk starts at 10:30 but will wait 10 minutes if there are late-comers.  Please meet in front of the visitor's center.

Directions

Borderland is located approximately three miles from the center of Sharon, Mansfield and North Easton, Massachusetts; the park is twenty miles from Boston and thirty miles from Providence, RI.

From north: Take Rte. 128 south to Rte. 95 south (towards Providence). Take exit 10 (Sharon, Walpole and Coney Street). Take a left at the end of the ramp and follow this road, two or three miles to the traffic lights in Sharon Center. Go straight thru this intersection and immediately bear right onto Pond St. Follow Pond St. for 1-1/2 miles until you come to a traffic rotary. Go half way around the rotary and continue onto Massapoag Ave. for three miles to the park entrance, on your left.

From Boston: Take the southeast expressway south to Rte. 128 north and then to Rte. 95 south. Follow directions from above.

From West: Mass Pike to Rte. 495 south to exit 10 (Easton and Rte. 123). Take a left at the end of the ramp and follow Rte. 123 east towards Easton. Rte. 123 will merge with Rte. 106 east. After this merge look for the brown "Borderland" sign, on the left about a half mile from the merge. Take this left onto Poquanticut Ave. After about a mile the road will fork, bear to the left onto Massapoag Ave. and follow the signs to the park, approximately another two miles. Entrance will be on your right.
results.how_to_find_us: Please meet in front of the Visitors Center
results.name: Enjoy 3 mile walk thru Borderlands State Park

results.description:
Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. New paddlers welcome at all times of the season.

Mon & Wed: 6pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm by the grassy patch near Barking Crab.  
Sat: 11am - 1pm, meet 10.45am by the grassy patch near Barking Crab.

Price: New paddler 2-class pack for $10. All other paddlers paddle unlimited under the $110 annual membership fee. New paddlers who decide to join get a $10 deduction from membership!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather! Be prepared to get wet!

Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards.  
Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended.  
Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen.

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locker provided on-site.

Please sign our e-Waiver before you get on the water

results.description:
The Israelite nation was developing its own identity and culture, but they were on the brink of destruction. The people wanted to find respect and recognition on the world stage, to feel secure and powerful, and to be prosperous and comfortable in their own homes.  But this was at a time when everyone was doing what was right in their own eyes.  Doesn't sound so different from today, does it?  But God wants to show us a better way--a man who will do all his will, a king after God's own heart.

Join us as we investigate the story of 1 Samuel and the different lessons for us!

results.description:
The 8th Annual Boston GreenFest ! 

While there will be a number of Asian vendors, the ecosystem and health of the population of China are recurrent issues discussed in this group.  

Speak whatever language, but it's lots of opportunity to explore global implications of current technologies, which are NOT without harms to all of us.

It's a great fun outing, also, for anyone to make a sub-trip.

This is the region's largest FREE multicultural environmental music festival. It is a celebration of life and possibility, providing you with ideas and experiences that can shape your life and the life of your community. 

It will showcase the many ways green living anywhere on the planet can make a positive impact on our shared world, nations, cities, neighborhoods, and each of us. 
Non-GMO food and eco-friendly vendors will be there :) 
http://www.BostonGreenfest.org/

over the 8 years, it has become more and more commercialized, but here are opportunities to see electric cars, MIT's latest thinktanks, lots of junk stuff and tzochkes, scientific presentations on the ecosystem (water systems, air systems, growing systems), and green roofs and green walls.  Anyone in technologies with impacts on the ecosystem will find much here to learn from and enjoy.

8th Annual Boston GreenFest 
Friday-Sunday, August 21-23, 2015 
Boston City Hall Plaza - FREE!
results.name: 8th Annual Boston GreenFest !  Boston City Hall Plaza

results.description:
Dear Bee'ple of BABA & BEEyond ~ Follow The Honey is super excited to share the lineup for this AUGUST 22 [and our 4th anniversary] hosting FREE community events/tastings daylong culiminating in a talk/book signing with 18 year old local beekeeper/blogger Orren Fox whose recently published "The Secret to Happy Honey Bees" proceeds go 100% to the BlinkNow Foundation.

Here's his inspiring story. In the summer of 2014, as a student on summer break from the Thatcher School in Ojai, California, where he set up beekeeping, Orren Fox travelled to Nepal. There, he volunteered with Maggie Doyne, whom he met in 2012 at the Do Lectures. Maggie, at age 19, began BlinkNow Foundation and the Kopila Valley Children’s School. With many children living in the natural and political difficulties of Nepal, Orren taught beekeeping to all in an effort to produce local honey for the village and for its profit. Now as a high school graduate, Orren will return to Surkhet, Nepal, to continue his efforts with the Kopila Valley School and Children's Home before starting college in the fall of 2016. Here’s the 100% do-good recipe: Simply buy the book, learn about bees, and help children in Nepal. How sweet it is.

Orren's book signing with be followed by music by the buzzing Boston band The Dirty Dottys who will serenade us under the stars as we mingle & hive mind.

Green River Ambrosia has generously donated limited supply of mead to tickle the senses so please do BYOBee spirits to share. 

Here's SOME of what to expect from local makers during the day's apis melliferous swarm:

Facepainting day long with Cambridge artist Angela Michelle Owens, founder of Painting as Art & Ritual.

12-3pm HoneyComb Creamery honeyed ice cream sampled by its luminous maker Kristen Rummel.

3-7pm BOTANICAL SPRINGS founders Mikal McCalmont & Francesco Capaldi with their Evolution Academy Bus with observation hive & honey sweetened beverages. 3-7pm Local loves Russ and Shari Apotheker with #beesweetened chocolate mallows & more!

7-9PM Orren Fox "The Secret to Happy Honey Bees"

Introducing Orren is Cambridge City Councilor Marc McGovern who is currently working to shephard a progressive urban beekeeping policy in Cambridge! 9pm ~ The Dirty Dotties

7-10pm The irrepressible Scoopsies ice cream founder Chloe Jankowitz sampling her creations all evening.


REMINDER!!!


Kicking off the celebration the night PRIOR ON 8/21 Friday FREE screening of "More Than Honey" next door at Karma Yoga sponsored by Green Cambridge, Karma Yoga Studio & Follow The Honey. Informal wine & cheese reception to discuss the film with fellow bee enthusiasts.
results.name: NATIONAL HONEY BEE DAY CELEBRATION with ORREN FOX & THE DIRTY DOTTYS

group.name: Meet The Honey Bee Stewards [& More!] Harvard Square

results.description:
Social In Boston Presents:

BOSTON ROOF DECKS TOUR

The Summer of 2015 is going to be a great one for the members of Social In Boston! One part of what makes it so great is our weekly roof deck tour. Each and every Saturday we'll be visiting a different roof deck for food, drinks, relaxation, and socializing. Please the details carefully every week, as the details are going to change. Some venues have better times to visit than others, and as already stated, each week will be in a different location...

Our Fourteenth Stop...

Atlantic Beer Garden is a stylish, modern sports bar in the Seaport area of South Boston. ABG is a large space, featuring multiple floors, patios and bars. There is a small outdoor deck downstairs that oversees the water, this is NOT the roof deck. You can go upstairs to the small bar inside a small room with some standing room and seating. Through here, you can access the fairly large roof deck that has an awesome view of the water and the city’s Financial District.

On the menu: Click here for the menu.

GETTING THERE

Atlentic Beer Garden is at 146 Seaport Boulevard, Boston Ma, 02210.

Click here for <a>directions on Google</a>. The nearest T stops are South Station on the Red Line, and the Aquarium stop on the Blue Line. You can catch a Silver Line bus from South Station by getting on bus SL1 or SL2, or you can walk from the Aquarium stop.

Parking: There is on street parking if you can find it, otherwise, check this Google map for parking in the Seaport District.

See you there Socialites!

~Matt
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us on the Roof Deck! : )
results.name: Boston Roof Decks Tour #14: Atlantic Beer Garden

results.description:
Hope to start shortly after the quarterly begins and will include the two expansions to the game:

Before you lies a vast bounty of land, ripe for the plucking. Your meager beginnings will influence the paths you must take. Lead your people well and they will take you to infinite heights of greatness. If civilization manages to endure the ages, your name will hang in every whisper of its legacy...

Fantasy Flight Games is excited to announce the upcoming release of Sid Meier’s Civilization: The Board Game! Forge an empire to stand the test of time using innovative game mechanics with multiple paths to victory.

Will you lead the greatest army in the world to conquer your foes? Or will you be the first to journey to the stars, becoming the most technologically advanced civilization known to man? The choice is yours.

Designed by Kevin Wilson, Civilization: The Board Game is inspired by the legendary video game series created by Sid Meier. Players are tasked with guiding an entire civilization throughout the ages, taking ownership of your people’s technology, economy, culture, and military, as well as all the choices that go along with them. There are four different paths to victory, and each is riddled with opposition.

In Civilization: The Board Game, 2-5 players take on the roles of famous leaders in charge of historical civilizations, each with their own abilities. Players will be able to explore a module game board, build cities and buildings, fight battles, research powerful technology, and attract great people by advancing their culture. No matter what your play style is, there is a civilization for you!

Fans of Sid Meier’s classic video game franchise will find familiar footing in Civilization: The Board Game. Staying true to the foundations of its video game predecessor while creating a new and unique way to play, Civilization: The Board Game captures the spirit and grandeur of carving out a magnificent empire from modest beginnings.

Players start off with a single city, one army figure, and one scout, and from these meager origins you must forge through the ages and become the greatest civilization in the world.

Those unfamiliar with the video game series will find Civilization: The Board Game a great way to enter into the world of Civilization. The strategy and tactical decisions involved in Civilization: The Board Game will appeal to strategy gamers and war gamers alike, and the ability to win through culture and technological advancement will give those who only wish to focus on their own empire a chance at victory as well.

The Fame and Fortune expansion for Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game provides players with new game options, and brings a host of enhancements.

Four new civilizations: The Arabs, the Spanish, the Greeks, and the Indians.

A new deck of "Great Person" cards that allows players to recruit the aid of specific figures from history, such as Joan of Arc, Marco Polo, Hannibal, or Gustavus Adolphus.

New map tiles, tech cards, culture event cards, and the introduction of the investment deck, which features cards that allow players to spend hard-earned coin to reap ongoing benefits.

Components for a fifth player.

With eleven new map tiles, over 150 cards, plus more than 120 markers and tokens, Fame and Fortune offers a remarkable set of engaging new options to guide your people to greatness!

In Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game - Wisdom and Warfare, six new civilizations join in the battle for supremacy: Aztecs, English, French, Japanese, Mongols, and Zulu – each with its own special powers. Along with the new civilizations comes new technologies, relics, wonders, and culture cards.

An alternative set of combat cards in which each unit now has separate Strength and Health values is provided for more tactical battles. With these new cards, a battle's winner is determined by comparing the total health minus the wounds of each side, plus any combat bonuses. Even if you can't completely kill a unit, damaging it will still have an effect on future turns.

Wisdom and Warfare also provides the rules for a new city action, "Starting a Building Program", which is a power-up for when that city produces something. This expansion also includes Social Policies that civilizations can adopt, such as "Rationalism" and "Organized Religion", and these policies offer options and provide bonuses for long-term planning.

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Sid Meier's Civilization at the All-Day Quarterly

Fitness doesn’t need to be intimidating or extreme, but it does need to produce good RESULTS! Come join TFW Boston for a fast paced, fun, and fulfilling workout. Our workouts will make you BETTER, not just tired, and our fitness familia will help you enjoy your time and ENCOURAGE you to give your best!

What to expect: 


- A challenging, motivating and downright fun environment for training.


- Experience the Training For Warriors ‘Hurricane’ workout as seen on ESPN, The New York Times, and Boston Fitness Magazine, and has created world champions in multiple professional sports


- Effective warm-ups to ensure all participants perform optimally and remain injury-free.


- Sweat, smiles, and lots of high-fives. 

What NOT to expect:

Fire in the Lake is a wargame published by GMT is part of their very popular COIN series, which focuses on Counter-Insurgency scenarios. This entry in the series focuses on Vietnam around 1964. The game is fairly heavy and fairly long (3+ hours, especially for newbies).

For more information on the game, take a look at the BGG page: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/144189/fire-lake

New players are welcome as this is my first time playing as well (as long as they are cool with long and heavy games!). I recommend if new players have the time, they scan the rulebook to get an understanding of the game (though I will also come prepared to teach as well, so this is not required). http://www.gmtgames.com/fireinthelake/FireLake-RULES-Final.pdf

results.description:
To celebrate what would have been his 125th birthday, the Brattle Theater in Cambridge will be showing a series of films in honor of writer H.P. Lovecraft. While not direct adaptations, both of these movies owe quite a bit to Lovecraft's pulp stories of horror and sci-fi.

In director Guillermo del Toro's "Hellboy," Ron Perlman's demonic title character attempts to stop a madman and his followers from unleashing cosmic creatures into our world. Creatures, by the way, who don't seem all too different from Lovecraft's Old Ones.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=557Qpie_KWk

"Hellboy" is then followed by John Carpenter's "The Thing," one of the most beloved movies in Carpenter's filmography and one of the few times a remake has surpassed the original version. Watch as Kurt Russell's MacReady and a team of Antarctic researchers are tormented by a constantly shapeshifting alien parasite. Lovecraft's protagonists would often deal with horror that was called "indescribable," and that's the best word to use regarding Rob Bottin's special effects work here. Well, that or freakin' awesome!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VnGBL-qrmvE

So the double feature starts at 12:45 PM on August 22nd. The plan is to be at the theater 15 minutes before the movies start, which will give us time to get tickets, snacks, and find our seats. If you have never been to the Brattle before, directions by car or public transportation are listed below.

http://www.brattlefilm.org/about-2/directions-parking/

UPDATES

I wanted to add a few additional bits of information before Saturday's Meetup happens. I plan to be outside the Brattle around 12:20 PM with a Meetup sign and my Christopher Lee T-shirt on. If you see the sign, come on over and say "Hi!" I would like to meet as many of the group as possible before the movies start.

Sitting down for two whole movies is a long stretch of time. I figure everyone will be hungry afterwards. So when "The Thing" wraps, the group can assemble outside the front of the Brattle and we can either try Shake Shack or Border Cafe for food and a chance to chat some more about the movies we saw.

https://www.shakeshack.com/location/harvard-square/


http://www.bordercafe.com/


Any questions regarding this Meetup, feel free to either email me or mention it in the comments section. Looking forward to seeing everyone on Saturday!
results.name: Hellboy (2004) / The Thing (1982) - Double Feature

Note: 

There will be no face to face meetup unless we reach 50 RSVPs by Thursday of the week. You must be enrolled in one of the 10 FREE courses below or similar courses. 

Our past experience is that 20% of the RSVP shows up in the weekend meetings. Considering that, unless we have about 50 RSVPs, we cannot have a face to face meeting. Please use the questions / answers / discussions below for now. While asking questions, please make reference to the name of the course and the related module within the course. 

Cousera offers the following classes towards obtaining highly valuable knowledge/skills in Data Science Specialization. It is sometimes hard to work on the exercises and homework without the help of an expert.  Receiving one-on-one help from an expert can improve the commitment of finishing the program with accelerated learning. With that in mind, we are experimenting with the following service.


An expert (MS or PhD in Statistics) will answer any question free that takes less than 10 minutes to solve. There are nominal fees for one-on-one interactive help.  Please use the following link to request for help, or just email [masked] or call[masked]-8864.

http://www.tutorteddy.com/courses/coursera-course-help.php 

You can get help for the following Data Science Specialization Classes:  (from https://www.coursera.org/specialization/jhudatascience/1?utm_medium=courseDescripTop )

The Data Scientist’s Toolbox

R Programming

Getting and Cleaning Data

Exploratory Data Analysis

Reproducible Research

Statistical Inference

Regression Models

Practical Machine Learning

Developing Data Products

Data Science Capstone

results.description:
***This meetup is restricted to people who have attended at least one discussion of the Knapsack meetup group in the last six months. (Most of our meetups count.)***

Each session includes time to: connect with each other, silently reflect and write about our anti-racism work, report on how we're doing regarding our anti-racism work, and receive feedback.  We usually do the reporting and feedback in small groups of 3-4 people.  If you can't stay as late as 3:30, please go ahead and RSVP, just let us know your limitations.

Remember to bring your notebook, if you have one!  (We'll have a few extra for anyone who hasn't come to an accountability session before.)

We have two options for the accountability session each month, hoping that those who want to join us will be able to go to one or the other.  You are welcome to attend both sessions, if you would like to do so. 


For more about our thoughts on these sessions, see "Open discussion to consider monthly accountability sessions."  Note: even if you don't claim to be doing anti-racism work, you can come to the session and see what it is about, as well as consider your own role. You still need to have met the requirement of having attended one of our discussion meetups within the last six months.


This is also a place where you can learn about and find an accountabilibuddy. 

Accessibility Information: Pappenheim Library at Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The sixth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  During regular hours there are usually two tables in the library which limit mobility, but these are normally moved elsewhere during Knapsack events.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.

results.description:
Join us for the August 2015 Meetup! We'll kick back and make and trade lots of ATCs, and work on other projects. We'll also talk about activities for the fall and beyond.


Can't make it on Saturday? Or, conversely, do you want to spend the whole weekend making art? Check out the Sunday gathering hosted by our sister Meetup group, ArtstART Studio.


AUGUST ATC THEMES: 

1. Put a bird on it (or a feather)

2. Artist's Choice

AND....JUNE ATC THEMES:

1. The 1970s!

2. Artist's Choice

AND...THE "GETAWAY" SWAP

1. Outside my comfort zone (only two of us made cards for this, so we'd like to see a few more).

DEMO/ACTIVITY: 

Finishing jam cards (that is, sets of ATCs made by multiple participants). We have 15 or so unfinished jam-card sets, so.. let's finish and distribute them! Participation is optional, but it's a great way to jump-start your creative efforts for the day, and you can work at your own pace. We'll provide envelopes for distributing finished cards to past participants. 

WHAT OTHER SUPPLIES SHOULD I BRING? There's a suggested list in "All About the NE ATC+ Meetup" (also at the top of the Message Board). But even if you show up empty-handed, that's fine--we have loaner tools.

POTLUCK LUNCH: You're invited, but certainly not required, to bring food or drink for our potluck lunch, or to just bring your own lunch. No need to sign up; bring whatever you like.

FREE STUFF/SALE ITEMS: You're welcome to bring items to give away or sell to other Meetup members onsite. Just remember to remove anything that doesn't get picked up or sold--we can't leave anything behind.

COST: $10, regardless of when you arrive or depart, to cover costs for space rental, supplies, and Meetup fees. Sorry, no partial payments or IOUs. Cash is preferred; small bills are greatly appreciated, but please don't pay in small change; the venue does not accept it. Need an ATM? There are several nearby. If payment is a hardship, please let the organizer know--we can work it out.

RSVPs: The RSVP list is our headcount for the day. If you plan to attend, RSVP "yes" so you'll receive all Meetup notifications. If your plans change, switch your RSVP to "no" by 24 hours in advance. If you cancel within 24 hours (or RSVP "yes" and don't show up), please plan to pay the fee anyway to help cover the costs for the day. 

LAST-MINUTE UPDATES: Please check your email in box and the website before leaving for the Meetup. That way, in the unlikely event that we need to cancel due to bad weather or any other reason, you'll be sure to get the news.

Hope to see you there!
results.name: NE ATC+ August 2015 Meetup--note 1 p.m. start time!

results.description:
{Do you seek greater inner peace?  Peacemakers is a group that helps you look at what "peace" means to you and helps you find how to create more peace in your life.} 

Our Topic This Evening Will ....

... provide you an opportunity to let go of tension, upset, and judgements so that you can experience greater peace.

Many of us have accepted living with tensions in our bodies, with upsets spoiling our mood at unexpected times, with judgments sneaking in. 

Come join us as we practice living our lives more peacefully. 

Peace is not being passive, submissive or indifferent. Peace is an active consciousness that we can learn to enter into, enriching our individual lives, our social situations and the world at large. 

During this evening, we will practice discovering the peace that is always present within us -- no matter what else is going on inside us or outside us in the world.   As we practice recognizing our inner core of peace, we become increasingly able to choose to live in that consciousness of inner peace, even at difficult times of our lives. 

We will look at where we unconsciously practice "against-ness", and learn to let go of that feeling of against-ness, to better work with reality and with the people who surround us. As we let go of "against-ness", we also let go of the upset feelings, prejudices, judgments, tenseness, etc. 

This meeting is sponsored by the Institute of Individual and World Peace (www.iiwp.org)

To Prepare ....

1) When do you feel "against-ness"?  


2) What are the physical signs of your against-ness? (e.g., tightness in throat)  

3) What emotional signs or mental beliefs could be signs of against-ness? 


4) How could you be more effective if you were in peace even when bad things happened?

Our Leaders This Evening

https://fbcdn-profile-a.akamaihd.net/hprofile-ak-prn2/v/t1.0-1/c39.0.160.160/p160x160/537349_10152034344599510_1494662630_n.jpg?oh=e6044f0c169d6d3bcd9bce21fb142bbc&oe=5615B058&__gda__=1446013507_b7d9a5381ee0960560099851af0e879a

David Jenkins aspires to live his life more and more in peace. He considers himself a student of living the four principles of peace in his life. This is his highest priority. He is overjoyed to have been involved with the Peacemaker Project for several years. It expands peace in a quiet, loving way, one person at a time.

Emily Page delights in finding joy with others and as an inner process one moment at a time.She's been assisting with Boston Area PeaceMaker Meetings because the simple tools shared go so deep, work so fast and foster such harmony between participants, one session after another. 


Philosophy: The philosophy grounding this work is the realization that peace must start with the individual. One can not fight for peace. If we are going to be a conduit for peace, we must start with ourselves and be in peace. Peace is defined as the absence of againstness. If we can be in peace without being against ourselves or others or situations and encourage others to do the same, then we can be a conduit for peace. 

Facilitators motivation: We aspire to live our lives more and more in peace. This intention is our highest priority. Participating in these meetings is one way to learn to live our lives more and more in peace. Encouraging others to do the same is strengthening for us all.
results.name: Peacemakers: Create Inner Peace for a Happier Life
